original: 'dir mna' chu btung bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'dir mna' chu btung bar bya dgos so //
translated: Here you must drink the water of an oath.

original: 'o na sad pa'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na sad pa'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: But if the object of a waking consciousness does not continue to exist in a dream state,

original: de'i phyir na gnyid log pa yun mi ring bar sad pa na lung dang gos bangs pa'i gnas skabs dus kyi cha shas re zhig la brten pa'i 'byung ba 'thob pa ga las yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir na gnyid log pa yun mi ring bar sad pa na lung dang gos bangs pa'i gnas skabs dus kyi cha shas re zhig la brten pa'i 'byung ba 'thob pa ga las yin /
translated: then how is it that when one awakens from a dream, after a short time, one obtains the elements that are the basis for the continuity of the body and the mind?

original: des na 'di rnam par mi phyed @45a * //
analyzed: des na 'di rnam par mi phyed @45a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that they are not distinguished.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na med par brtag par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na med par brtag par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: It is not possible to think that they do not exist in a dream.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: rmi lam na snang ba rnams la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam na snang ba rnams la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the same is true of the appearances in a dream.

original: de dag kyang rmi lam gzhan la rjes su 'jug par snang la /
analyzed: de dag kyang rmi lam gzhan la rjes su 'jug par snang la /
translated: They also appear to continue in another dream.

original: des na de dag kyang sad pa na rjes su mi 'jug na rmi lam gzhan la rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de dag kyang sad pa na rjes su mi 'jug na rmi lam gzhan la rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if they do not continue to exist when one awakens, they would not continue to exist in another dream.

original: des na 'di dag ma dmigs kyang dus gzhan na med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na 'di dag ma dmigs kyang dus gzhan na med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, even though they are not perceived, how could they not exist at another time?

original: 'di thams cad rim lam gzhan la rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di thams cad rim lam gzhan la rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: All of this is not the case for the other gradual paths.

original: sad pa na snang ba thams cad kyang sad pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams ma yin zhes bya ba mtshungs so //
analyzed: sad pa na snang ba thams cad kyang sad pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams ma yin zhes bya ba mtshungs so //
translated: It is the same to say that when one is awake, all appearances are not the case for the other who is awake.

original: gnyid gcig la yang gnyid log pa'i snang bas khyab par mi byed na 'di dag gnyid gzhan la nges par rjes su 'jug pa de ga las she na /
analyzed: gnyid gcig la yang gnyid log pa'i snang bas khyab par mi byed na 'di dag gnyid gzhan la nges par rjes su 'jug pa de ga las she na /
translated: If one does not pervade even one dream with the appearances of the dream, how can one be certain that these are the case for another dream?

original: 'o na sad pa'i snang ba yang sad pa gcig la yang nges par khyab par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'o na sad pa'i snang ba yang sad pa gcig la yang nges par khyab par mi byed de /
translated: Well, the appearances of the waking state do not pervade even one waking state.

original: des na 'di dag kyang gzhan la rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di dag kyang gzhan la rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, these are not the case for another.

original: 'ga' zhig rjes su mi 'jug kyang de las gzhan rjes su 'jug par dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rjes su mi 'jug kyang de las gzhan rjes su 'jug par dmigs so zhe na /
translated: Even if some are not the case, it is observed that others are the case.

original: rmi lam gyi snang ba la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi snang ba la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The same applies to the appearances of dreams.

original: rmi lam gyi snang ba rmi lam gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa med pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi snang ba rmi lam gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa med pa kho na yin nam /
translated: Are the appearances of dreams not the case for another dream?

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i snang ba'i bag chags sad par mtshungs pas na snga ma dang 'dra ba'i snang ba 'byung bar zad do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i snang ba'i bag chags sad par mtshungs pas na snga ma dang 'dra ba'i snang ba 'byung bar zad do zhe na /
translated: Since the latent impressions of such appearances are awakened in the same way, the appearances that arise are just like those in the waking state.

original: sad pa'i snang ba yang yin no //
analyzed: sad pa'i snang ba yang yin no //
translated: The appearances in the waking state are also like that.

original: gal te de ltar rtog pa mdza' bos 'dod pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtog pa mdza' bos 'dod pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: If you think that way, then the friend who wishes to help you has accomplished his purpose.

original: rmi lam na snang ba rnams yun ring du mi gnas pas na mi bden pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam na snang ba rnams yun ring du mi gnas pas na mi bden pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But the appearances in dreams are not real because they do not last long.

original: 'o na sad pa na dmigs pa'i glog la sogs pa yun ring du mi gnas par 'dod pa rnams dang brtan pa dang mi ldan pa gzhan yang mi bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na sad pa na dmigs pa'i glog la sogs pa yun ring du mi gnas par 'dod pa rnams dang brtan pa dang mi ldan pa gzhan yang mi bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, you assert that lightning and so on that are observed in the waking state do not last long, and other things that are not stable are not real.

original: skad cig so so la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i kun tu rtog pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de dag kyang de skad smra ba'i lha dga' ba ltar na shin tu gsal bar med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig so so la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i kun tu rtog pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de dag kyang de skad smra ba'i lha dga' ba ltar na shin tu gsal bar med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The differences in the conceptions that arise in each moment are also not clear at all for the gods who speak that way.

original: rmi lam na mthong ba rnams yun ring du mi 'jug pa na mi bden par smra ba gang yin pa de na sad pa na mthong ba rnams bzlog pa yin pas bzlog par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na mthong ba rnams yun ring du mi 'jug pa na mi bden par smra ba gang yin pa de na sad pa na mthong ba rnams bzlog pa yin pas bzlog par brjod par bya'o //
translated: When the things seen in a dream do not last long, you say that they are not true. But when you are awake, the things you see are the opposite of those in a dream, so you should say that they are the opposite of not true.

original: de lta na yang 'dis yun ring du rjes su 'jug pa'i rmi lam na snang ba yang smra dgos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dis yun ring du rjes su 'jug pa'i rmi lam na snang ba yang smra dgos te /
translated: But even so, you must admit that things seen in a dream last for a long time.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam kha cig ni yud tsam gyis 'jig la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam kha cig ni yud tsam gyis 'jig la /
translated: Some dreams are destroyed in an instant,

original: de las gzhan ni sad pa'i dus @45b kyi bar du rjes su 'jug pa yin no //🔽de lta bur gyur pa mi bden pa yin yang dus gzhan du rjes su 'jug par 'thad do zhe na /🔽bden pa yin yang dus gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa 'ga' zhig yud tsam gyis 'jig pa mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de las gzhan ni sad pa'i dus @45b kyi bar du rjes su 'jug pa yin no // de lta bur gyur pa mi bden pa yin yang dus gzhan du rjes su 'jug par 'thad do zhe na / bden pa yin yang dus gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa 'ga' zhig yud tsam gyis 'jig pa mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: but others last until you wake up.🔽Even though they are not true, it is possible for them to last for a while.🔽But is it not also possible for something that is true to be destroyed in an instant and not last for a while?

original: bag chags kyi khyad par gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba mi bden pa rnams kyang 'ga' kho na dus gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags kyi khyad par gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba mi bden pa rnams kyang 'ga' kho na dus gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though they are not true, some things that arise through the power of a special predisposition last for a while.

original: gal te 'di srid pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di srid pa yin na /
translated: If this is possible,

original: sad pa'i snang ba yang de lta bu yin mod //
analyzed: sad pa'i snang ba yang de lta bu yin mod //
translated: then the appearances of the waking state are also like that.

original: de'i phyir gnyid log pa'i snang ba sad pa'i snang ba thun mong ma yin par mi bden par sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyid log pa'i snang ba sad pa'i snang ba thun mong ma yin par mi bden par sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to prove that the appearances of the waking state are not true, in contrast to the appearances of the dream state.

original: gzhan yang 'di dag phyi rol gyi ngo bor mi bden pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di dag phyi rol gyi ngo bor mi bden pa yin nam /
translated: Moreover, are these not true as external objects?

original: 'on te shes pa'i ngo bo yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i ngo bo yin grang /
translated: Or are they the nature of consciousness?

original: de la gal te phyi rol gyi ngo bor yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te phyi rol gyi ngo bor yin na /
translated: If they are external objects,

original: kho bo cag la sad pa'i snang ba de las bzlog par ma grub pas na chos mi mthun par brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag la sad pa'i snang ba de las bzlog par ma grub pas na chos mi mthun par brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: we cannot say that they are dissimilar, because the appearances of the waking state are not established as being the opposite of that.

original: 'on te shes pa'i ngo bar yin na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i ngo bar yin na /
translated: But if they are the nature of consciousness,

original: 'di ni rmi lam gyi snang ba la gnod byed dam dus gzhan du rjes su mi 'jug pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rmi lam gyi snang ba la gnod byed dam dus gzhan du rjes su mi 'jug pas kyang rung ste /
translated: then this is also not established, because the appearances of the dream state are not engaged in another time, even though they are harmed by the appearances of the waking state.

original: tshangs pas kyang sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: tshangs pas kyang sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Even Brahma cannot establish this.

original: 'di ltar gnod par byed pas ni phyi rol gyi ngo bo tsam sol gyi shes pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnod par byed pas ni phyi rol gyi ngo bo tsam sol gyi shes pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the harm is only the external object, but not the nature of consciousness.

original: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa ni gnod byed kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo las nyams pa ni mi byed de /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa ni gnod byed kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo las nyams pa ni mi byed de /
translated: The hairs and so on seen by one with myodesopsia do not lose their nature as the object of a cognition that is impaired.

original: de skad du /🔽shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don //
analyzed: de skad du / shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don //
translated: As it is said:🔽Because the object is of the nature of cognition,

original: yin phyir gsal bar snang ba nyid //
analyzed: yin phyir gsal bar snang ba nyid //
translated: it is clearly manifest.

original: ces pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don //
translated: If the object is of the nature of cognition,

original: yin na spyi la'ang thal bar 'gyur //🔽de ltar 'dod phyir skyon yod min //
analyzed: yin na spyi la'ang thal bar 'gyur // de ltar 'dod phyir skyon yod min //
translated: it follows that it is a universal.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because we accept it that way, there is no fault.

original: rmi lam gyi snang ba 'di dag ni don bya ba byed par snang na ji ltar med pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi snang ba 'di dag ni don bya ba byed par snang na ji ltar med pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If these appearances in a dream perform a function, how can they be nonexistent?

original: de dag ni don byed pa 'ga' yang byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni don byed pa 'ga' yang byed pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not perform any function at all,

original: de dag gi don bya ba ni med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi don bya ba ni med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their function is nonexistent.

original: 'on kyang snang ba de dang de las 'khrul pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba de dang de las 'khrul pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, error arises from those appearances.

original: de ci 'di dag rgyu med pa yin nam /
analyzed: de ci 'di dag rgyu med pa yin nam /
translated: Are they without a cause?

original: 'on te rgyu dang ldan pa yin rgyu med pa yin na ni dus nges par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang ldan pa yin rgyu med pa yin na ni dus nges par mi 'gyur la /
translated: But if they are caused, they would not be definite in time.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa yin na de dag gi rgyu gang yin pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa yin na de dag gi rgyu gang yin pa brjod dgos so //
translated: If they are caused, then you must state what their cause is.

original: rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the complete maturation of their own habitual tendencies,🔽then even without the error of fire, etc., the error of burning, etc.

original: me la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa med par yang sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa 'byung bar @46a * //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa med par yang sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa 'byung bar @46a * //
translated: would occur.

original: 'gyur ro // me la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa kho na sreg pa la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // me la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa kho na sreg pa la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the error of fire, etc. is the cause of the error of burning, etc.,

original: 'o na sad pa'i snang ba yang don bya ba med kyang bden par grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na sad pa'i snang ba yang don bya ba med kyang bden par grub par 'gyur te /
translated: then even the appearances in a dream would perform a function, even though they are not real.

original: 'khrul pa tsam yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the mere error is established as the cause and effect of error.

original: sad pa'i snang ba bden pa nyid du smra ba rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi snang ba mi bden par smra ba gang yin pa de'i ltar na rmi lam du bud med dang phrad pa'i bde ba sad par rjes su 'gro ba dang khu ba 'byung ba'i 'bras🔽bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sad pa'i snang ba bden pa nyid du smra ba rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi snang ba mi bden par smra ba gang yin pa de'i ltar na rmi lam du bud med dang phrad pa'i bde ba sad par rjes su 'gro ba dang khu ba 'byung ba'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you say that the appearances of the waking state are real and the appearances of the dream state are not real, then the pleasure of sexual intercourse in a dream would not be followed by the result of emission in the waking state.

original: bde ba de ni bud med dang phrad pa las skyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bde ba de ni bud med dang phrad pa las skyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That pleasure is not produced by sexual intercourse with a woman.

original: 'on kyang sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par las yin no //
translated: But it is produced by a special state of the mind.

original: 'o na sad pa na bud med dang phrad pas bskyed pa'i bde ba ci 'dra bar dmigs pa de 'dra ba med pa na 'byung bar ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: 'o na sad pa na bud med dang phrad pas bskyed pa'i bde ba ci 'dra bar dmigs pa de 'dra ba med pa na 'byung bar ji ltar 'thad /
translated: If the pleasure that is observed in the waking state when one has intercourse with a woman does not exist in the same way in a dream, how could it occur?

original: 'byung na ni rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung na ni rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does occur, then it would follow, absurdly, that it would be causeless.

original: de'i phyir sad pa dang gnyid log pa la khyad par 'ga' yang med de ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sad pa dang gnyid log pa la khyad par 'ga' yang med de ;
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest difference between the waking state and the dream state.

original: mngas pas chog go //
analyzed: mngas pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i snang ba don med pa las khyed kyis yul la sogs pa nges pa mi 'thad par thal ba byas pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i snang ba don med pa las khyed kyis yul la sogs pa nges pa mi 'thad par thal ba byas pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, you have argued that it is untenable that consciousness ascertains objects and so on because the appearances of consciousness are meaningless.

original: de la kho bo cag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la kho bo cag 'di skad du /
translated: We would respond to that as follows.

original: ji ltar gnyid log pa'i snang ba don med kyang yul nges pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa de bzhin du sad pa la yang yin no zhes smra ba yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyid log pa'i snang ba don med kyang yul nges pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa de bzhin du sad pa la yang yin no zhes smra ba yin na /
translated: Just as the appearances of one who is asleep are meaningless, they are still endowed with the ascertainment of objects and so on. The same is true of the waking state.

original: de la 'dir sad pa na dmigs pa rnams bden pas phyir 'jil ba'i skabs ci yod /
analyzed: de la 'dir sad pa na dmigs pa rnams bden pas phyir 'jil ba'i skabs ci yod /
translated: So what opportunity is there to refute the objects of observation of the waking state by the objects of observation of dreams?

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na /
translated: If external objects do not exist,

original: 'o na ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: what does exist?

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i //
translated: The consciousness free from apprehended and apprehender

original: rnam shes dam pa'i don du yod //
analyzed: rnam shes dam pa'i don du yod //
translated: exists in the ultimate.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las grol ba'i rnam par shes pa dam pa'i don sgro ma btags pa'i ngo bor yod cing bdog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las grol ba'i rnam par shes pa dam pa'i don sgro ma btags pa'i ngo bor yod cing bdog pa yin no //
translated: The consciousness free from apprehended and apprehender exists in the ultimate, in the entity that is not a superimposition.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no apprehended and apprehender,

original: blo yi nyams myong bya gzhan med //
analyzed: blo yi nyams myong bya gzhan med //
translated: there is no other experience of the mind.

original: de yi myong ba gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de yi myong ba gzhan yod min //
translated: Its experience is not of anything else.

original: de ni de ltar rang nyid gsal //
analyzed: de ni de ltar rang nyid gsal //
translated: It is thus that it is self-illuminating.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ;
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ;
translated: The Lord has also said:🔽External objects do not exist

original: / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //🔽phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar // phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
translated: As they are imagined by the childish.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: It is the mind disturbed by the latent afflictions

original: don du snang bar rab tu 'byung //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don du snang bar rab tu 'byung // zhes gsungs so //
translated: That appears as objects.

original: de la kha cig ni 'di skad du //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni 'di skad du //
translated: To this, some say:

original: lus dang yul gyi ngo bor grags pa 'di thams cad ni rnam par @46b shes pa nyid yin la /🔽de yang rang rig pa yin pas na /
analyzed: lus dang yul gyi ngo bor grags pa 'di thams cad ni rnam par @46b shes pa nyid yin la / de yang rang rig pa yin pas na /
translated: All this that is known as the nature of body and objects is consciousness itself.

original: gang gis kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gis kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin la /
translated: And that is self-knowing, so it is not a subject-object duality.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo ni rtog pas sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo ni rtog pas sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: The nature of subject and object is a conceptual superimposition.

original: des na kun tu btags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bden pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na kun tu btags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bden pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, consciousness, which is free from the nature of subject and object that is a conceptual superimposition, is the truth.

original: gzhan ni don dam par rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa'i dri ma mtha' dag gis ma sbags  par shel dag pa dang 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan ni don dam par rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa'i dri ma mtha' dag gis ma sbags  par shel dag pa dang 'dra ba yin la /
translated: The other is that ultimately consciousness is uncontaminated by all the stains of conceptualization, like a pure crystal.

original: rnam pa 'di dag ni phyin ci log kho nar ma rig pas bstan pas snang ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag ni phyin ci log kho nar ma rig pas bstan pas snang ba yin te /
translated: These aspects are taught to be appearances due to error by ignorance.

original: des gzung ba zhes bya ba ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des gzung ba zhes bya ba ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: What is called “the object” does not exist at all.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du med pas na rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa po gang yin pa de yang med do zhe'o //🔽rnal 'byor spyod gzhung rgya mtsho yi //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du med pas na rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa po gang yin pa de yang med do zhe'o // rnal 'byor spyod gzhung rgya mtsho yi //
translated: Since it does not exist in any way, the apprehender of consciousness also does not exist.🔽Yogācāras who have reached the other side of the ocean of texts

original: pha rol son rnams de skad sgrogs //
analyzed: pha rol son rnams de skad sgrogs //
translated: proclaim this.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnam par shes par smra ba'i gzhung kho na zab cing gting dpag dka' ba rin thang med pa de kho na rin po che'i gzhi rgya mtsho ste chu gter yin la de'i pha rol pha mthar son pa rnams de skad du sgrog go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnam par shes par smra ba'i gzhung kho na zab cing gting dpag dka' ba rin thang med pa de kho na rin po che'i gzhi rgya mtsho ste chu gter yin la de'i pha rol pha mthar son pa rnams de skad du sgrog go //
translated: The texts of the Yogācāra Proponents of Consciousness are profound and difficult to fathom. They are a priceless source of jewels, an ocean, a treasure of water. Those who have reached the other side of that ocean proclaim this.

original: 'o na dbu ma pa rnams kyi lta ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbu ma pa rnams kyi lta ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the view of the Mādhyamikas?

original: mkhas rnams rnam shes de nyid kyang //
analyzed: mkhas rnams rnam shes de nyid kyang //
translated: The wise do not accept that consciousness exists

original: dam pa'i don ni yod mi 'dod //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni yod mi 'dod //
translated: even conventionally.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi don dam par yod par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang mkhas pa rigs pa'i de kho na rig pa rnams don dam pas spyod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi don dam par yod par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang mkhas pa rigs pa'i de kho na rig pa rnams don dam pas spyod par mi 'dod do //
translated: The wise, who know the reality of reasoning, do not accept that the consciousness which the Yogācāra accepts as existing ultimately exists even conventionally.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is devoid of the nature of being one or many,

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral phyir nam mkha'i padma bzhin //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral phyir nam mkha'i padma bzhin //
translated: like a sky-flower.

original: rang bzhin du 'thad pa ni don dam par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin du 'thad pa ni don dam par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: That which is tenable as the nature of reality is accepted as the ultimate.

original: de yang gcig gam du mar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang gcig gam du mar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, it must be either one or many.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yin la /
translated: This consciousness is devoid of being one or many.

original: des na 'di nam mkha' chu skyes bzhin du don dam pa yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na 'di nam mkha' chu skyes bzhin du don dam pa yin par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, like a sky-lotus, it is not tenable that it is the ultimate.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: “The subject, consciousness, does not ultimately exist because of being devoid of the nature of being one or many.

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma bzhin no //
translated: It is like a sky-lotus.”

original: rnam par shes pa 'di yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is a non-observation of a p e v a d e d .

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This reason is not unestablished.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na phyi rol gyi don bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang mi ldan par gsal @47a * //🔽ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na phyi rol gyi don bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang mi ldan par gsal @47a * // ba'i phyir te /
translated: If consciousness were to have aspects, like external objects, it would be devoid of a nature of unity or multiplicity, because it is clear.

original: gang la 'jig rten gyis phyi rol gyi don du tha snyad 'dogs pa de kho na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten gyis phyi rol gyi don du tha snyad 'dogs pa de kho na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i shes pa yin no //
translated: That which the world designates as an external object is the consciousness of those who advocate consciousness with aspects.

original: de'i phyir de phyi rol yin na gnod byed yod pa gang yin pa de kho na nang yin na yang yod do //🔽gnod byed kyis ni rags pa gcig yin pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de phyi rol yin na gnod byed yod pa gang yin pa de kho na nang yin na yang yod do // gnod byed kyis ni rags pa gcig yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if it were external, whatever is the case of the existence of the fault would also be the case of the existence of the fault if it were internal.

original: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin du ma yin pa sel la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin du ma yin pa sel la /
translated: The fault refutes that it is a single coarse unit or that it is a multiplicity of subtle atoms.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di yang gal te rags pa gcig yin pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di yang gal te rags pa gcig yin pa'am /
translated: If this aspect that is the nature of consciousness is one gross thing,🔽

original: gal te rdul phran du tha dad pa'i du ma yin grang na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phran du tha dad pa'i du ma yin grang na /
translated: If this aspect, which is of the nature of consciousness, is gross, or if it is multiple, being different atoms,

original: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang phyi rol gyi don gyi phyogs la yod pa'i sun 'byin pa gsal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang phyi rol gyi don gyi phyogs la yod pa'i sun 'byin pa gsal bar mi nus so //
translated: in both cases, the refutation that applies to the external object theory also applies to this theory.

original: gang gis de ma yin na mi 'byung ba sun 'byin pa ni rnam par shes pa de'i phyi rol yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de ma yin na mi 'byung ba sun 'byin pa ni rnam par shes pa de'i phyi rol yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
translated: The refutation that it does not occur if that is not present is not a reason for the external object to be of the nature of that consciousness.

original: lus kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi gnod byed lus med pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la med do zhes bya ba yang snying po med pa yin te ;
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi gnod byed lus med pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la med do zhes bya ba yang snying po med pa yin te ;
translated: The refutation that the body is not the cause of the harm is meaningless for the consciousness that is of the nature of the body.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na rnam par shes pa yang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na rnam par shes pa yang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it has an aspect, consciousness also has a body.

original: yul rgyas pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid lus yin na /
analyzed: yul rgyas pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid lus yin na /
translated: If the aspect is the body, which is associated with the extensive object,

original: 'di phyi rol yin na lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di phyi rol yin na lus zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the body when it is external.

original: shes pa yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa 'di kho bo cag gis dus 'di tsam gyi bar du ma rig go //
analyzed: shes pa yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa 'di kho bo cag gis dus 'di tsam gyi bar du ma rig go //
translated: But we have never before seen a connection between the name and the named, such as “It is consciousness, but it is not that.”

original: dngos po'i ngo bo la ma reg pa'i sun 'byin pa ni ming tsam gyis 'jug par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo la ma reg pa'i sun 'byin pa ni ming tsam gyis 'jug par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not right to engage in refutation without touching on the nature of things, merely by using names.

original: rang bzhin gyis yod pa ni ming tsam gyis ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yod pa ni ming tsam gyis ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: And intrinsic reality is not refuted merely by using names.

original: 'di snyam du gang dag gi ltar na rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang ldan pa de dag la skyon 'di yod kyi ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang dag gi ltar na rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang ldan pa de dag la skyon 'di yod kyi ;
translated: You might think, “This fault applies to those who assert that consciousness has aspects.

original: gang dag gis phyogs rnam pa dang bral ba'i rtog pa tsam de kho na yin pa de dag la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba 'di ma grub pa'i lam la gnas par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gis phyogs rnam pa dang bral ba'i rtog pa tsam de kho na yin pa de dag la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba 'di ma grub pa'i lam la gnas par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But for those who assert that the object is only the mere conception that is free from aspects, how could they not be standing on a path that is not tenable, since the absence of a nature that is either one or many is not established for them?”

original: brjod pa 'di rnam par shes pa ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di rnam par shes pa ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: We respond: Consciousness has the nature of clarity.

original: de dag gi gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i gsal ba ni rmi lam na yang myong ba med do //🔽sngon po la sogs pa mi bden pa yin pa gzhan rnam par shes pa de lhag lus pa ci yod /🔽ji ste 'dir sngon po la sogs pa snang ba na dus mnyam du nang gi bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i gsal ba ni rmi lam na yang myong ba med do // sngon po la sogs pa mi bden pa yin pa gzhan rnam par shes pa de lhag lus pa ci yod / ji ste 'dir sngon po la sogs pa snang ba na dus mnyam du nang gi bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yin la /
translated: Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.

original: de la bsnyon na ni @47b mi bsnyon pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med do //🔽snang ba'i sngon po nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de la bsnyon na ni @47b mi bsnyon pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med do // snang ba'i sngon po nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.🔽Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.

original: snang ba ni bde ba nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par chad pa'i sngon po 'di bde ba yin no zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: snang ba ni bde ba nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro // rnam par chad pa'i sngon po 'di bde ba yin no zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Apart from the blue that is the manifestation of that, there is no manifestation that is experienced even in a dream.

original: bde bar gyur pa yin no zhes ni 'gas kyang rig pa med kyi /
analyzed: bde bar gyur pa yin no zhes ni 'gas kyang rig pa med kyi /
translated: Apart from the blue that is the manifestation

original: 'jig rten ning bde'o zhes bde ba na bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhir gzhen par byed la /
analyzed: 'jig rten ning bde'o zhes bde ba na bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhir gzhen par byed la /
translated: The world is happy” is the basis for the attachment to self.

original: gang zhig mngon sum sngon du song ba'i zhen pas ji ltar yul du byed pa de ni gnod pa byed pa med na de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum sngon du song ba'i zhen pas ji ltar yul du byed pa de ni gnod pa byed pa med na de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is made an object by the attachment that is preceded by direct perception is to be posited in that way, if there is no refutation of it.

original: de lta ma yin na kun rdzob pa'i tha snyad kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa de nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na kun rdzob pa'i tha snyad kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa de nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the conventions of the conventional would not be tenable, and consciousness itself would be the apprehender of blue and so on.

original: de lta na yang gzung bar bya ba'am 'dzin par byed pa zhig gsal grang na de gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzung bar bya ba'am 'dzin par byed pa zhig gsal grang na de gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: Even so, if it is clear that it is either an object of apprehension or an apprehender, it is not an object of apprehension.

original: des na 'dzin pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dzin pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore it is an apprehender.

original: 'di las kyang 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Also, it is an apprehender from this.

original: gang nga sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin no zhes 'dzin pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nyid du zhen par byed la /
analyzed: gang nga sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin no zhes 'dzin pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nyid du zhen par byed la /
translated: “I apprehend blue and so on” is the basis for the attachment to self.

original: bkod pas dben par snang ba de la gzung ba'i rnam pa dang thun mong du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa tshad ma'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: bkod pas dben par snang ba de la gzung ba'i rnam pa dang thun mong du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa tshad ma'i yul ma yin no //
translated: The appearance that is devoid of arrangement is empty of the nature of one and many in common with the aspect of the object of apprehension. It is not the object of valid knowledge.

original: des na gnod byed kyis ma bkag pa nyams su myong bas grub /
analyzed: des na gnod byed kyis ma bkag pa nyams su myong bas grub /
translated: Therefore, the non-negation by a fault is established by experience.

original: bde ba'i bdag nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa brdzun pa ma yin pa 'di la blo dang ldan pas brtsad par mi 'os so //
analyzed: bde ba'i bdag nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa brdzun pa ma yin pa 'di la blo dang ldan pas brtsad par mi 'os so //
translated: It is not appropriate for the wise to dispute this false consciousness of the nature of pleasure and so on and blue and so forth.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni myong du zin kyang gnod byed kyis bsal bas na brdzun pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni myong du zin kyang gnod byed kyis bsal bas na brdzun pa kho na'o //
translated: Although blue and so on are experienced, they are false because they are refuted by faults.

original: 'dzin pa nyid na gzung ba la ltos pa'i phyir de med na de yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa nyid na gzung ba la ltos pa'i phyir de med na de yang med do zhe na /
translated: Since at the time of apprehension there is a dependence on the object of apprehension, if that does not exist, it also does not exist.

original: ci 'dzin pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'di gzung ba la ltos pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'dzin pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'di gzung ba la ltos pa yin nam /
translated: Is this apprehension of the nature of pleasure and so on dependent on the object of apprehension?

original: 'on te 'dzin pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'dzin pa nyid yin /
translated: Or is it the apprehension itself?

original: de la rang gi ngo bo gzung ba la ltos pa ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de la rang gi ngo bo gzung ba la ltos pa ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Of those, it is not tenable that the nature is dependent on the object of apprehension.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni gzung ba la ltos nas thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni gzung ba la ltos nas thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Its own nature is not obtained in dependence on the object.

original: 'dzin pa nyid ni gzung ba la ltos pa de med na med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa nyid ni gzung ba la ltos pa de med na med pa yin no //
translated: The apprehender is not the apprehended. If the object does not exist, the apprehender does not exist.

original: de tsam gyis dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la nyams pa ci yang med do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la nyams pa ci yang med do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that there is no fault in the aspect of joy and depression and so on,

original: 'di thams cad ni snying po med pa nyid kyis na chu shing gi sdong bu la co 'dri ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni snying po med pa nyid kyis na chu shing gi sdong bu la co 'dri ba yin te /
translated: then all of this is like beating a plantain tree, because it is devoid of essence.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag dang tha mi dad pas na de dang 'dra bar brdzun pa yin no zhes kho bo cag gis brjod @48a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag dang tha mi dad pas na de dang 'dra bar brdzun pa yin no zhes kho bo cag gis brjod @48a * // pa yin no //
translated: Thus we say that consciousness of blue and so on is false because it is not different from them.

original: de mi bzod pas ni de nyid tha dad par brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de mi bzod pas ni de nyid tha dad par brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Since you cannot accept that, you must say that they are different.

original: bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa la ni kho bo cag mi mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa la ni kho bo cag mi mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not disagree that pleasure and so on are different.

original: des na 'bad pas sgrub pa 'di ci dgos /
analyzed: des na 'bad pas sgrub pa 'di ci dgos /
translated: What is the need for this effort?

original: de nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is consciousness of blue and so on.

original: 'di ni gtam rgyud yin te ;
analyzed: 'di ni gtam rgyud yin te ;
translated: This is a story.

original: gang gis de de'i shes par 'gyur ba sngon po la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs par gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de de'i shes par 'gyur ba sngon po la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs par gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: The blue, etc., are not the manifestation of pleasure, etc., because of that.

original: gal te des gsal ba'i bdag nyid sgrub na 'di des gsal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te des gsal ba'i bdag nyid sgrub na 'di des gsal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were to establish the nature of the manifestation, then it would be manifested by that.

original: de ni mi srid de /
analyzed: de ni mi srid de /
translated: But that is impossible,

original: gzugs med pa la gzugs gzhag par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / dus mtshungs pa dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yin na dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la gzugs gzhag par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / dus mtshungs pa dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yin na dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable to posit form in the formless, because there is no nature of cause and effect in those that are simultaneous, and because if it were the effect, it would be an entity.

original: de ni bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be transformed.

original: de bsal ba bsal bas na des bsal bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bsal ba bsal bas na des bsal bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is to be manifested by that because it is manifested by the manifestation.

original: de bsal bas na bsal lo zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
analyzed: de bsal bas na bsal lo zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of “it is manifested because it is manifested by that”?

original: 'di bsal ba de bsal ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin nam /
analyzed: 'di bsal ba de bsal ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin nam /
translated: Is the manifestation of this the reason for the manifestation of that?

original: 'on te de'i dus su yin /
analyzed: 'on te de'i dus su yin /
translated: Or is it at that time?

original: phyogs dang po ni snga ma khyad par med pas na de'i sun 'byin pa nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang po ni snga ma khyad par med pas na de'i sun 'byin pa nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin no //
translated: The first possibility is not so, because it is no different from the former.

original: gnyis pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: The second is also not correct.

original: dus mnyam du bya ba tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: dus mnyam du bya ba tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is merely the simultaneous action that is the illumination,

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang de 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang de 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: then pleasure, etc. would also be that.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: sngon po la sogs pa med pa ni gsal bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa med pa ni gsal bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not tenable that the nonexistence of blue, etc. is illumination.

original: gal te med pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te med pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If nonexistence is not illumination,

original: gsal bar byed pa yang ci ltar yin /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yang ci ltar yin /
translated: how could illumination be?

original: gsal bar byed pa ni gsal bar nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni gsal bar nus pa yin la /
translated: Illumination is the capacity to illuminate,🔽but it is not tenable that nonexistence has capacity.

original: med pa la nus pa mi 'thad ma yin gyis gsal bar bya ba ni mi 'thad pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa la nus pa mi 'thad ma yin gyis gsal bar bya ba ni mi 'thad pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not tenable that nonexistence is illuminated,

original: 'o na ji ltar med pa la nus pa med pa bzhin du yod pa yang med pa yin pas na bde ba la sogs pa yang gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar med pa la nus pa med pa bzhin du yod pa yang med pa yin pas na bde ba la sogs pa yang gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then just as nonexistence has no capacity, so existence also is nonexistent. Therefore pleasure, etc. would not be illumination.

original: de lta na yang sngon po la sogs pa yang gsal bar bya ba ga la yin /
analyzed: de lta na yang sngon po la sogs pa yang gsal bar bya ba ga la yin /
translated: In that case, how could blue and so on be illuminated?

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu la nus pa nye bar mkho ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu la nus pa nye bar mkho ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the effect is dependent on the potency,

original: gsal bar bya ba med pa ni 'bras bu ma yin pas nus pa nye bar 'jog pa legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba med pa ni 'bras bu ma yin pas nus pa nye bar 'jog pa legs pa ma yin no //
translated: since that which is not illuminated is not an effect, it is not tenable to posit the existence of the potency.

original: gzhan yang shes pa'i dus su sngon po la sogs pa gsal lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa'i dus su sngon po la sogs pa gsal lo //
translated: Moreover, blue and so on are illuminated at the time of consciousness.

original: des 'di la cung zad @48b kyang byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des 'di la cung zad @48b kyang byed pa ma yin no //
translated: That does not do the slightest thing to this.

original: 'o na rang nyid gsal lo zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na rang nyid gsal lo zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: Well, then, it would be said that it is itself illuminated.

original: ji ste med pa la rang gsal ba med na /
analyzed: ji ste med pa la rang gsal ba med na /
translated: If that which does not exist is not illuminated,

original: da ni ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be illuminated now?

original: gang yang rang bzhin mi gsal zhing gzhan las kyang ma yin pa de ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang rang bzhin mi gsal zhing gzhan las kyang ma yin pa de ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could that which is not illuminated by itself or by another be illuminated?

original: med pa ni mi gsal ba kho na yin la /🔽ma rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pas de gsal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: med pa ni mi gsal ba kho na yin la / ma rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pas de gsal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: That which does not exist is only not illuminated.🔽Consciousness, which has the nature of ignorance, illuminates it.

original: rnam par shes pas ni de gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ni de gsal bar byed de /
translated: Consciousness illuminates it.

original: de ni gsal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na'i lta ba chen po yin te /
analyzed: de ni gsal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na'i lta ba chen po yin te /
translated: That is not clear” is the great view of reality.

original: rnam par shes pas de gsal bar byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas de gsal bar byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Consciousness does not make that clear.

original: gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i ngo mtshar 'di ci yin /
analyzed: gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i ngo mtshar 'di ci yin /
translated: What is the wonder of saying “it makes that clear”?

original: des na phrad par bya ba'i las yin pa na sngon po la sogs pa rang gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: des na phrad par bya ba'i las yin pa na sngon po la sogs pa rang gsal ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, when it is the object of contact, blue and so on are intrinsically clear.

original: rang gsal ba la ni gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: rang gsal ba la ni gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: And there is nothing at all called “making clear” in intrinsic clarity.

original: gsal bar mi byed pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar mi byed pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ma yin la /
translated: That which does not make clear is not called “apprehending.”

original: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa tsam gyis ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa tsam gyis ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid mi 'thob ste /
translated: And mere nonapprehensibility does not obtain the status of apprehender,

original: sngon po la sogs pa gzung ba ma yin yang 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gzung ba ma yin yang 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though blue and so on are not apprehended, they are not apprehenders.

original: nga 'di 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i zhen pa las kyang 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nga 'di 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i zhen pa las kyang 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not apprehender from the attachment “I apprehend this.”

original: gnod pa byas pa'i yul can rnam pa gzhan du rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa'i yul can rnam pa gzhan du rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of harm is conceived in another way.

original: 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i lus kyang 'dis 'dzin par byed par zhen te ;
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i lus kyang 'dis 'dzin par byed par zhen te ;
translated: Also, the body is not a grasper, but it is conceived to be a grasper.

original: des na des las bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ga la 'grub /
analyzed: des na des las bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ga la 'grub /
translated: Therefore, how can it be established that it is a grasper of pleasure, etc.?

original: bde ba la sogs pa tsam bdag tu 'dzin pas yul du byed pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa tsam bdag tu 'dzin pas yul du byed pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that pleasure, etc., are taken as objects by the conception of the self,

original: nga bde ba yin no zhes bya bar myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga bde ba yin no zhes bya bar myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no experience of the sort “I am pleasure.”

original: phung po lnga po mtha' dag la rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga po mtha' dag la rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The self is conceived in relation to the entire collection of the five aggregates,

original: bdag dkar sham mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ngar 'dzin pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //🔽lnga ka yul yin pa na lus kyang de'i khongs su gtogs pas yul ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dkar sham mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ngar 'dzin pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // lnga ka yul yin pa na lus kyang de'i khongs su gtogs pas yul ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: because the form of the conception of “I,” such as “I am fair,” and so on, is seen.🔽If the five are the objects, then the body is included in them and is not an object.

original: de yang bems po'am med pa yin yang rung ste /🔽'dzin pa ma yin mod kyi zhen par byed pas na /
analyzed: de yang bems po'am med pa yin yang rung ste / 'dzin pa ma yin mod kyi zhen par byed pas na /
translated: Moreover, it is not a grasper, even though it is matter or non-existent.🔽But it is conceived,

original: zhen pa las kyang 'dzin par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: zhen pa las kyang 'dzin par mi 'grub po //
translated: so it is not established that the conception of the self is a grasper.

original: gang zhig gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos par gsal bde shes pa yin pas na sngon po la sogs pa kho nar shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos par gsal bde shes pa yin pas na sngon po la sogs pa kho nar shes pa yin no //
translated: Since consciousness is clear and does not depend on another for its clarity, it is consciousness of blue, etc.

original: de skad du tshad ma pa'i gtsug gi nor bus /
analyzed: de skad du tshad ma pa'i gtsug gi nor bus /
translated: In this way, the crest-jewel of logicians [Dharmakīrti] says:

original: de yi sngo sogs ngo bo ni //
analyzed: de yi sngo sogs ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of blue, etc.,

original: rang bzhin de ni myong ba'ang yin //🔽rang gi ngo bor myong yin yang //
analyzed: rang bzhin de ni myong ba'ang yin // rang gi ngo bor myong yin yang //
translated: is the experience of that.

original: sngon @49a * //🔽po la sogs myong bar brjod //
analyzed: sngon @49a * // po la sogs myong bar brjod //
translated: Although it is experienced as its own nature,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: it is said to experience blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa kho nas shes pa yang de yin pas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ga la yin /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa kho nas shes pa yang de yin pas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ga la yin /
translated: Since consciousness is just the emptiness of blue, etc., of being either one or many, how can the reason be unestablished?

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even so, is it not that the reason is not established with respect to one part?

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang chos can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang chos can yin no //
translated: In this way, consciousness of blue, etc., and consciousness of pleasure, etc., are the subjects.

original: de la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni sngon po la sogs pa la grub mod /
analyzed: de la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni sngon po la sogs pa la grub mod /
translated: With respect to that, the emptiness of being either one or many is established for blue, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so for pleasure, etc.

original: de ni lus med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lus med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not physical.

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te de yang yul la khyab par snang ba bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te de yang yul la khyab par snang ba bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is not so, because it is undeniable that they appear to pervade their objects.

original: ngal ba'i yan lag ji snyed cig chur nub pa de snyed du khyab pa'i bde ba skyed par myong la /
analyzed: ngal ba'i yan lag ji snyed cig chur nub pa de snyed du khyab pa'i bde ba skyed par myong la /
translated: As many parts of the body as are immersed in water produce the experience of pervasive pleasure.

original: de ltar myong ba yang yul la ma khyab pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar myong ba yang yul la ma khyab pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: And this experience is not called nonpervasive,

original: lus kyang de lta bur thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyang de lta bur thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body would follow suit.

original: yul la khyab pa mtshungs pa na lus bzhin du 'dir yang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la khyab pa mtshungs pa na lus bzhin du 'dir yang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the pervasiveness of the object is the same, then like the body, pleasure, etc. would also have a body.

original: tsandan dang tsher ma 'byug pa dang / 'drud pa'i bkod pa'i rjes su byed par gzhol ba'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba grub pas na lus can ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: tsandan dang tsher ma 'byug pa dang / 'drud pa'i bkod pa'i rjes su byed par gzhol ba'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba grub pas na lus can ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Since the experience of pleasure, etc. is established as conforming to the arrangement of the application of sandalwood paste and the dragging of a saw, how could they be nonphysical?

original: gzhan yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin pa rnams bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad yin du chug / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi lus las tha dad pa ni yid la re ba tsam gyi yul yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin pa rnams bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad yin du chug / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi lus las tha dad pa ni yid la re ba tsam gyi yul yin te /
translated: But it is an object of mere wishful thinking that the body, which is the domain of the conception of self, is different from the self.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni lus las tha dad par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni lus las tha dad par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Pleasure and so on do not appear as different from the body.

original: 'o na lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
translated: But the body itself is not the mind.

original: de grub kyang blo'i rnam par rtog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de grub kyang blo'i rnam par rtog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: It cannot be said that even if the body exists, the mind is doubted.

original: 'byung ba sems pa can yin pa dgag pa'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba sems pa can yin pa dgag pa'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to refute the idea that the elements are sentient, it should be said:

original: gal te rang gi lus su myong ba'i 'byung ba dag las blo tha mi dad na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi lus su myong ba'i 'byung ba dag las blo tha mi dad na /
translated: If the mind is not different from the elements experienced in one’s body,

original: de mngon sum du byed pa na yang de yang mngon sum du 'gyur bas na blo'i yul la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do ;
analyzed: de mngon sum du byed pa na yang de yang mngon sum du 'gyur bas na blo'i yul la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do ;
translated: then when the body is directly perceived, the mind would also be directly perceived, and so the object of the mind would not be doubted.

original: /'dir ni bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus las tha mi dad par rtogs la /
analyzed: /'dir ni bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus las tha mi dad par rtogs la /
translated: Here, pleasure and so on are understood to be not different from the body, which is of the nature of consciousness.

original: de la yang gnod par byed pa 'di mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la yang gnod par byed pa 'di mi 'thad de /
translated: And it is not tenable that they are harmed by that.

original: rnam par shes par smra ba lta na /
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba lta na /
translated: If one is a proponent of consciousness,

original: gzhan gyi lus gzhan gyis mi 'dzin pas na gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus gzhan gyis mi 'dzin pas na gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since one body is not apprehended by another, the reason is not established as having the property.

original: @49b lus dang ldan pa'i lus po las tha mi dad pa ni lus med pa yin pas mi 'os so //
analyzed: @49b lus dang ldan pa'i lus po las tha mi dad pa ni lus med pa yin pas mi 'os so //
translated: And it is not appropriate that what is not different from the body that possesses it is bodiless.

original: des na phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yang skabs med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yang skabs med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no establishment with respect to one part of the position.

original: yang shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa kho na phyogs su byas nas khyab byed mi dmigs pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa kho na phyogs su byas nas khyab byed mi dmigs pa dgod par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, having taken as the position that consciousness is only with aspects, the nonobservation of the pervader should be stated.

original: de lta na yang cha la ma grub pa ga la yin /
analyzed: de lta na yang cha la ma grub pa ga la yin /
translated: In that case, how could there be nonestablishment with respect to a part?

original: 'o na bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa med pa mi bden par 'ji ltar brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa med pa mi bden par 'ji ltar brjod par bya /
translated: Well then, how could it be said that the consciousness of pleasure and so on, which is without aspect, is not true?

original: gang mi bden pa'i rgyu can yin pa de ni mi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: gang mi bden pa'i rgyu can yin pa de ni mi bden pa yin te /
translated: That which has an unreal cause is unreal,

original: dper na myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu bzhin no //
translated: like a sprout.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang mi bden pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang mi bden pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And pleasure, etc. have an unreal cause, this is a natural inference.

original: lus mi bden pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la sogs pa de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus mi bden pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la sogs pa de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is not unestablished because the body is unreal and pleasure, etc. have that as their cause.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni shes pa snga ma'i rgyu can yin gyi lus kyi rgyu can ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni shes pa snga ma'i rgyu can yin gyi lus kyi rgyu can ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Pleasure, etc. have the prior cognition as their cause, not the body as their cause.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: lus kyi yang ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi yang ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cessation and occurrence of pleasure, etc. is seen to follow the cessation and occurrence of the body.

original: mig la sogs pa'i phan 'dogs pa yod na mig las byung bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i bde ba skye bar snang la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i phan 'dogs pa yod na mig las byung bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i bde ba skye bar snang la /
translated: When there is the benefit of the eye, etc. the pleasure, etc. that are held to arise from the eye, etc. are seen to occur.

original: de'i phan 'dogs pa med na mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phan 'dogs pa med na mi snang ngo //
translated: When there is no benefit of that, they are not seen.

original: mig la sogs pa ni de la phan 'dogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni de la phan 'dogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The eye, etc. are not the benefit of that.

original: 'on kyang der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams yin no zhe na /
translated: But they are the cognitions that appear as those.

original: gal te der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams phan 'dogs na de dag kyang gdon mi za bar phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams phan 'dogs na de dag kyang gdon mi za bar phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cognitions that appear as those benefit, then they also undoubtedly benefit.

original: de dag gis phan 'dogs pa ni de skyed ba na yod par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can kho na yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis phan 'dogs pa ni de skyed ba na yod par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can kho na yin la /
translated: The benefit is only the characteristic of existing when they are produced.

original: de ni de dag la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni de dag la yang mtshungs so //
translated: That is the same for those.

original: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa de dag yod pa kho na yod pa de bzhin du de dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa de dag yod pa kho na yod pa de bzhin du de dag kyang yin no //
translated: Just as those such as pleasure exist only when they exist, so do they.

original: de dag tu snang ba na 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag tu snang ba na 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: When they appear, they exist,

original: yod pa kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but they do not exist when they do not appear.

original: der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams kyang snang ba na yin gyi yod pa na ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams kyang snang ba na yin gyi yod pa na ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognitions that appear as those also exist when they appear, but they do not exist when they do not appear.

original: snang ba'i bdag nyid can 'di dag snang ba kho na yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba'i bdag nyid can 'di dag snang ba kho na yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that these, which have the nature of appearance, exist only when they appear,

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi lus kyi yod pa yang de kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi lus kyi yod pa yang de kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Why wouldn’t the existence of the body, which has the same nature, be just that?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan yang lus ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan yang lus ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were to have a relation of inherence, the body is not the cause,

original: mi bden pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not real.

original: tshig gi tshul ni nyams pa yin te /🔽gang gi de yod kyang ma yin pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi de'i ngo bo rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las @50a * //
analyzed: tshig gi tshul ni nyams pa yin te / gang gi de yod kyang ma yin pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi de'i ngo bo rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las @50a * //
translated: The way of the words is lost.

original: gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin no //
translated: If it is not the cause of that, then the nature of the cause and effect is not different from the relation of inherence and reverse inherence.

original: gzhan yang lus su snang ba'i shes pa rgyu yin yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mi bden par grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus su snang ba'i shes pa rgyu yin yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mi bden par grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, even if the consciousness appearing as the body is the cause, it is established that the cause of pleasure and so on is not real,

original: lus mi bden pa yin na der snang ba'i shes pa yang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pas tha dad pa med par grub pas na mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus mi bden pa yin na der snang ba'i shes pa yang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pas tha dad pa med par grub pas na mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the body is not real, the consciousness appearing as that is also established to be not different through the ascertainment of simultaneous observation, and therefore it is not real.

original: 'di ltar gang dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa de dag ni gcig yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa de dag ni gcig yin te /
translated: Thus, those that are ascertained to be simultaneously observed are one,

original: dper na shes pa dang de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa dang de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: like consciousness and its own nature.

original: lus dang der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis 'di dag tha dad med par grub par byed do //
analyzed: lus dang der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis 'di dag tha dad med par grub par byed do //
translated: This is established as non-different by a natural logical argument.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir //🔽sngo dang de blo gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir // sngo dang de blo gzhan ma yin //
translated: Because of the ascertainment of simultaneous apprehension,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The blue and the cognition of it are not different.

original: gang zhig lhan cig dmigs pas nges par gcig bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig lhan cig dmigs pas nges par gcig bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that something is definitely established as one by simultaneous apprehension.

original: 'on kyang tha dad med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad med pa yin te /
translated: However, they are not different.

original: gang zhig gang dang nges par lhan cig dmigs pa de ni de las gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang nges par lhan cig dmigs pa de ni de las gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is definitely simultaneously apprehended with something is not different from that,

original: dper na zla ba gcig las gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zla ba gcig las gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: like a second moon.

original: don yang rang gi shes pa dang nges par lhan cig dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs par slob dpon bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: don yang rang gi shes pa dang nges par lhan cig dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs par slob dpon bzhed pa yin no //
translated: And the object is definitely simultaneously apprehended with its cognition. This is the master's assertion of the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: tha dad pa ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa med pas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa med pas khyab pa yin te /
translated: If they are different, they are not necessarily simultaneously observed, so they are not pervaded.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are different, then they are not necessarily simultaneously observed, because they are unrelated.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin no snyam du sems pa de ni legs par sems pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin no snyam du sems pa de ni legs par sems pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the opposite of that is the ascertainment of simultaneous observation, then that is not proper thought.

original: gal te lhan cig dmigs pa nges par 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig dmigs pa nges par 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin na /
translated: If the ascertainment of simultaneous observation is the reason for a relationship,

original: de'i tshe de med na nges pa med par 'gyur ba zhig na /🔽mi bden pa dang de'i shes pa bdag la 'brel pa med pa kho nar de yod na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de med na nges pa med par 'gyur ba zhig na / mi bden pa dang de'i shes pa bdag la 'brel pa med pa kho nar de yod na /
translated: then when that does not exist, there would be no ascertainment.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin la /
translated: But it is not suitable for the unreal and its cognition to be the reason for a relationship, because they are unrelated.

original: des na 'brel pa yod dam med kyang ste /
analyzed: des na 'brel pa yod dam med kyang ste /
translated: Therefore, whether or not there is a relationship,

original: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'di srid pa na /
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'di srid pa na /
translated: if the ascertainment of simultaneous observation is possible,

original: rang gi 'gal zla mi 'gog pa dang / tha dad pa yang srid pas na 'di ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa ji ltar ma yin /
analyzed: rang gi 'gal zla mi 'gog pa dang / tha dad pa yang srid pas na 'di ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa ji ltar ma yin /
translated: then since it is possible that its opposite is not refuted and that they are different, how could it not be uncertain and not ascertained?

original: khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa yang ji ltar yin zhes ma rig go //
analyzed: khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa yang ji ltar yin zhes ma rig go //
translated: How is there observation of an incompatible pervasion?

original: rigs pa shes pa shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgya cher 'grel pa mdzad pa'i dgongs pa rigs pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa shes pa shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgya cher 'grel pa mdzad pa'i dgongs pa rigs pa chen po yin no //
translated: The intention of the author of the commentary is that the reason is a cognition that is accompanied by an awareness of the mode.

original: dngos po @50b yin na 'brel pa la ltos pa yin gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po @50b yin na 'brel pa la ltos pa yin gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is a thing, it depends on a relation, but if it is not a thing, it does not.

original: 'di ni rgyal ba'i bka' yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal ba'i bka' yin te /
translated: This is the word of the Victor:

original: dngos po med pa la 'brel pa med kyang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la 'brel pa med kyang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin na /
translated: If the ascertainment of simultaneous observation is in a non-thing, even without a relation,

original: de 'di'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de 'di'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pas na /
translated: then it is not the reason for that.

original: dngos po la yang de med par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po la yang de med par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, why would it not be absent in a thing?

original: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'di rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'di rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: This ascertainment of simultaneous observation is reasonable,

original: rgyu mtshan med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is not unreasonable.

original: 'brel pa kho na ni rgyu mtshan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa kho na ni rgyu mtshan ma yin gyi /
translated: A relation alone is not the reason.

original: ma rig pa'i nus pas yongs su zin pas na bden pa'i bdag nyid ston pa ni shin tu med pa'i don yang ston pa yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i nus pas yongs su zin pas na bden pa'i bdag nyid ston pa ni shin tu med pa'i don yang ston pa yin la /
translated: Since it is completely taken hold of by the power of ignorance, it teaches the reality of a self, and it also teaches the meaning of complete non-existence.
