original: nges pa yang dag pa la ni dgos pa ci yang med kyi 'on kyang nges par bya ba la yod do //
analyzed: nges pa yang dag pa la ni dgos pa ci yang med kyi 'on kyang nges par bya ba la yod do //
translated: There is no purpose in a true ascertainment, but there is in what is to be ascertained.

original: nges pa yang dag pa ma yin pas yang dag pa nges pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa yang dag pa ma yin pas yang dag pa nges pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How can there be a true ascertainment from a false ascertainment?

original: 'o na log pa'i snang ba can gyi rjes su dpag pas kyang phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na log pa'i snang ba can gyi rjes su dpag pas kyang phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, even an inference with a false appearance would not ascertain reality without error.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa las yang dag pa des na sgrub byed ltar snang ba las der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa las yang dag pa des na sgrub byed ltar snang ba las der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there is a true ascertainment from what is not true, then it follows that there is a proof from a false proof.

original: 'di'i yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ni sgrub byed ltar snang ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'di'i yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ni sgrub byed ltar snang ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The falsity of this is not ascertained, like the apparent proof.🔽

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The falsity of this is not because of non-ascertainment, like a seeming proof, nor is it because of contradiction,

original: ma nges pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
translated: nor is it because of non-ascertainment,

original: 'on kyang don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but rather because ultimately there is no intrinsic reality.

original: des na 'di las yin dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na 'di las yin dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is because of the absence of intrinsic reality ultimately in this that it is false.

original: des na 'di las yin pa bzhin du sgrub byed ltar snang ba las kyang nges pa 'byung bar ji ltar 'os /
analyzed: des na 'di las yin pa bzhin du sgrub byed ltar snang ba las kyang nges pa 'byung bar ji ltar 'os /
translated: So how can there be ascertainment from a seeming proof, just as there is from this?

original: sgra mtshungs pa tsam gyis ni don mtshungs pa 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra mtshungs pa tsam gyis ni don mtshungs pa 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not obtain the same meaning by mere similarity of words.

original: 'dis ni @62a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni @62a * //
translated: This also

original: kha cig na re /🔽gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re / gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: rejects the claim of some

original: nges pa'i yul yang dag pa yin na tshad ma ltar snang ba'i yul yang ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: nges pa'i yul yang dag pa yin na tshad ma ltar snang ba'i yul yang ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: that if the object of non-error is real, then why is the object of seeming valid knowledge not real?

original: 'dir yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgra mtshungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgra mtshungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the words “non-error” are similar,🔽but the meanings are not similar.

original: don ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: don ni ma yin no ;
translated: But it is not the case that it is not the object.

original: ;'di ltar tshad ma ltar snang ba ni zhen par byas pa'i yul la bslu bas yang dag pa ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: ;'di ltar tshad ma ltar snang ba ni zhen par byas pa'i yul la bslu bas yang dag pa ma yin pa yin la /
translated: Thus, a seeming valid cognition is not valid because it is deceptive with regard to the object that it apprehends.

original: skabs su bab pa ni nges pa zhen pa'i yul la mi bslur zin kyang don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa ni nges pa zhen pa'i yul la mi bslur zin kyang don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: But the one at hand is not deceptive with regard to the object that it apprehends, but it is not valid because it is devoid of the nature of the ultimate.

original: des na gal te dbu ma pa tshad ma khas len kyang rung /
analyzed: des na gal te dbu ma pa tshad ma khas len kyang rung /
translated: Therefore, whether or not a Mādhyamika accepts valid cognition,

original: gal te khas mi len kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te khas mi len kyang rung ste /
translated: whether or not he accepts it,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: it cannot be said that “it is impossible to posit all phenomena as emptiness.”

original: kun rdzob kyi tshad ma ltar snang las log pa'i kun rdzob zhen pa'i yul la mi bslu ba'i shes pa de dag gis tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshad ma ltar snang las log pa'i kun rdzob zhen pa'i yul la mi bslu ba'i shes pa de dag gis tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he accepts as valid cognition the consciousnesses that are undeceiving with regard to the object that is the object of adherence of the concealer, which is the opposite of the seeming valid cognition of the concealer.

original: des na bstan pa 'di la lta ba'i chu bur byung ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na bstan pa 'di la lta ba'i chu bur byung ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the arising of the bubbles of views in this teaching.

original: kha cig thams cad yod par smra ba dang / kha cig thams cad med par smra ba'i zhes gang brjod pa 'di yang mi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig thams cad yod par smra ba dang / kha cig thams cad med par smra ba'i zhes gang brjod pa 'di yang mi rigs pa yin te /
translated: but this is not correct,🔽because they are not nihilists in the sense intended,

original: dbu ma pa la bsams nas de skad brjod pa'i phyir dang de dag gi grub mtha' yang de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pa la bsams nas de skad brjod pa'i phyir dang de dag gi grub mtha' yang de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because their philosophy is not like that.

original: yang na sdang ba la su zhig nus te /
analyzed: yang na sdang ba la su zhig nus te /
translated: Or, who would be angry at them?

original: de la brtags pas chog go //
analyzed: de la brtags pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this investigation.

original: rigs pa dang lung gis rtogs pa'i grub mtha' cad blo dang ldan pa'i dbu ma pa la 'ji ltar sdang ba zhes mi rigs so /🔽'di snyam /'di snyam du re zhig gang dag gzhan du yod pa nyid rtogs kyang ngan song med do //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung gis rtogs pa'i grub mtha' cad blo dang ldan pa'i dbu ma pa la 'ji ltar sdang ba zhes mi rigs so / 'di snyam /'di snyam du re zhig gang dag gzhan du yod pa nyid rtogs kyang ngan song med do //
translated: It is not correct to say that the wise Madhyamikas are angry at any philosophy, whether it is based on reasoning or scripture.🔽Some think that the Lokayatas are nihilists because they do not accept the existence of past and future lives, and because they say that there is no afterlife,

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes lta ba de dag kyang med pa pa yin no zhes te yod pa'i 'jig rten sdang ba yin na /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes lta ba de dag kyang med pa pa yin no zhes te yod pa'i 'jig rten sdang ba yin na /
translated: that there is no karmic result of good and bad actions.

original: gang dag thams cad med par lta ba'i dbu ma pa de dag med pa'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bu yin na ji ltar mi sdang bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gang dag thams cad med par lta ba'i dbu ma pa de dag med pa'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bu yin na ji ltar mi sdang bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that the Madhyamikas who view everything as nonexistent are the crest jewels of the assembly of nihilists, how could they not be nihilists?

original: de ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: de ni ma yin te ;
translated: That is not so.

original: med par lta ba med pas na dbu ma pa med pa pa nyid du ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par lta ba med pas na dbu ma pa med pa pa nyid du ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not view nonexistence, it is not tenable that the Madhyamikas are nihilists.

original: yod pa bkag pa nyid kyis med pa'i yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa bkag pa nyid kyis med pa'i yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are nihilists because they refute existence,

original: med pa bkag pa nyid kyis yod pa par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
analyzed: med pa bkag pa nyid kyis yod pa par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
translated: why do you not accept that they are essentialists because they refute nonexistence?

original: slob dpon klu grub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /🔽gal te yod pa sun phyung ba //🔽nyid kyis med pa @62b 'phen yin na //
analyzed: slob dpon klu grub kyi zhal snga nas kyis / gal te yod pa sun phyung ba // nyid kyis med pa @62b 'phen yin na //
translated: The master Nagarjuna said:🔽If refuting existence🔽Implies asserting nonexistence,

original: med pa sun ni phyung nyid kyi //
analyzed: med pa sun ni phyung nyid kyi //
translated: Then by refuting nonexistence

original: yod pa ci yi phyir mi 'thob //🔽ces gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ci yi phyir mi 'thob // ces gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: Why wouldn’t existence be obtained?

original: gal te don dam pa pa'i yod pa bkag pas med pa par 'dod na god pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: gal te don dam pa pa'i yod pa bkag pas med pa par 'dod na god pa ci yang med do //
translated: If you accept that they are nihilists because they refute ultimate existence, there is no problem.

original: ji ste kun rdzob pa'i yod pa yang bkag pa'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: ji ste kun rdzob pa'i yod pa yang bkag pa'i phyir yin na /
translated: But if you accept that they are nihilists because they refute even conventional existence,🔽then

original: de ni bkag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bkag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not prohibited.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yi //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yi //
translated: The essence of cause and effect

original: kun rdzob bkag pa ma yin phyir //
analyzed: kun rdzob bkag pa ma yin phyir //
translated: is not negated in the conventional.

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang sogs //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang sogs //
translated: Thus, the presentation of the thoroughly afflicted and the completely pure

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'jig ma yin //🔽zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'jig ma yin // zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: is not destroyed.

original: dngos po rnams kyi mchog tu gsang ba 'di nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo rnams su phye ba yin na /🔽gang gis de dag la sdang ba de la ma gus pa rnams la de la mos pas nyes pa ci zhig yin/ gang zhig dbu ma'i de kho na mngon du gyur pa dbu ma pa'i mchog bcom ldan 'das la ni gus la mos pa tsam gyi sgo nas
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi mchog tu gsang ba 'di nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo rnams su phye ba yin na / gang gis de dag la sdang ba de la ma gus pa rnams la de la mos pas nyes pa ci zhig yin/ gang zhig dbu ma'i de kho na mngon du gyur pa dbu ma pa'i mchog bcom ldan 'das la ni gus la mos pa tsam gyi sgo nas
translated: This very secret of the supreme of all things was revealed by the Transcendent Lord in the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras and so forth, the Mahayana Sutras.🔽If someone is hostile to those, what is wrong with being devoted to them out of respect for those who are devoted to them?

original: dbu ma pa yin pa'i skye bo la skye bo sdang ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pa yin pa'i skye bo la skye bo sdang ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar ro //
translated: It is amazing that those who are hostile to the person who is a Follower of the Middle Way are hostile to the one who is devoted to the Transcendent Conqueror, the supreme Follower of the Middle Way, who has actualized the suchness of the Middle Way.

original: de bas na dbu ma pa la sdang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sdang ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dbu ma pa la sdang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sdang ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, those who hate the Madhyamikas hate all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: dbu ma'i sgrub pa kho na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pas na /
analyzed: dbu ma'i sgrub pa kho na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pas na /
translated: The practice of the Madhyamaka is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de spong ba na de yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de spong ba na de yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when they reject it, they also reject that.

original: rgyal ba'i yul ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo can yin la /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yul ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo can yin la /
translated: The domain of the Victorious One is the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de'i lta ba can du smra ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de'i lta ba can du smra ba ni /
translated: To say that the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas have a view of that is

original: shin tu skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
translated: a great denial.

original: des na yod pa'i lce rten can mchog tu med pa dmyal ba la gzhol ba 'di ni rang brlag cing gzhan yang rlag par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: des na yod pa'i lce rten can mchog tu med pa dmyal ba la gzhol ba 'di ni rang brlag cing gzhan yang rlag par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is a tongue-based existence that is supremely non-existent and is headed for hell. It is self-destructive and destructive of others.

original: dad pa blun pas 'jig rten bslus pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa blun pas 'jig rten bslus pa yin no //
translated: The world is deceived by foolish faith.

original: gang dag rgya mtsho chen po'i gnya' shing gi bu gar ru sbal gyi mgrin pa chud pa lta bu'i mi nyid dang shin tu thob par dka' ba'i bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dad pa yang thob nas /
analyzed: gang dag rgya mtsho chen po'i gnya' shing gi bu gar ru sbal gyi mgrin pa chud pa lta bu'i mi nyid dang shin tu thob par dka' ba'i bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dad pa yang thob nas /
translated: Those who have obtained human existence, which is as difficult as a turtle putting its neck through the hole of a yoke tossed about on the turbulent ocean, and who have obtained faith in the doctrine of the Well-Gone, which is so difficult to obtain,

original: theg pa chen po la skur pas dal 'byor chud gzon pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni mchog tu mya ngan bya ba'i 'os yin no ;
analyzed: theg pa chen po la skur pas dal 'byor chud gzon pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni mchog tu mya ngan bya ba'i 'os yin no ;
translated: and who have wasted this opportunity by denigrating the Great Vehicle, are worthy of the highest sorrow.

original: / tshul chen po la brnyas pa 'di ni bslu ba chen po yin zhing /
analyzed: / tshul chen po la brnyas pa 'di ni bslu ba chen po yin zhing /
translated: This contempt for the Great Vehicle is a great deception.

original: rnam par spyod pa dang bral ba chen po yang yin te /
analyzed: rnam par spyod pa dang bral ba chen po yang yin te /
translated: It is also a great lack of spiritual practice.

original: des na 'di ni skal pa dman pa'i nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni skal pa dman pa'i nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a misdeed of those of little good fortune.

original: 'di ni bde 'gro'i snyad can mchog tu ngan song du ltung ba yin zhing /🔽'di ni de dag gis bde ba dang phan pa phun sum @63a * //
analyzed: 'di ni bde 'gro'i snyad can mchog tu ngan song du ltung ba yin zhing / 'di ni de dag gis bde ba dang phan pa phun sum @63a * //
translated: It is a great fall into miserable realms for those who have the name of good destiny.

original: tshogs pa mi bzod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa mi bzod pa yin te /
translated: It is an intolerance of the complete abundance of happiness and benefit for those who have obtained the human existence of leisure and opportunity.

original: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Because the so-called Great Vehicle is the Bodhisattva path together with its result.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du lta ba yang byang chub sems dpa'i lam bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du lta ba yang byang chub sems dpa'i lam bla na med pa yin te /
translated: And the view that all phenomena are empty is the unsurpassed Bodhisattva path.

original: des na de spangs pa na theg pa chen po ma spangs pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de spangs pa na theg pa chen po ma spangs pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin gyi /
translated: So how could it be that if you reject that, you do not reject the Great Vehicle?

original: gnyis kyis stong par lta ba lam yin pas na skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong par lta ba lam yin pas na skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: You might say, “The view of emptiness of duality is the path, so this fault does not apply to us.”

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kho na de dang der bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kho na de dang der bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Blessed One taught that all phenomena are emptiness in various places:

original: chos 'di thams cad rang bzhin stong pa ste //
analyzed: chos 'di thams cad rang bzhin stong pa ste //
translated: All these phenomena are empty by nature.🔽The children of the victors destroy all things,

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams dngos po rnam par 'jig / srid pa thams cad yong ye stong pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams dngos po rnam par 'jig / srid pa thams cad yong ye stong pa ste //
translated: And all existences are always empty.

original: nyi tshe'i stong nyid mu stegs can rnams kyi //🔽thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: nyi tshe'i stong nyid mu stegs can rnams kyi // thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The emptiness of the tīrthikas is limited.🔽All things have the characteristic of space.

original: nam mkha' la ni mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni mtshan nyid med //
translated: Space has no characteristic.

original: 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa //
translated: The entire triple world

original: thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin //
analyzed: thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin //
translated: is like an illusion.

original: mthong ba dang ni reg pa nyid //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni reg pa nyid //
translated: What is seen and touched

original: kun tu sgyu ma ji bzhin te //
analyzed: kun tu sgyu ma ji bzhin te //
translated: is like an illusion.

original: 'gro ba'i gnas pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gnas pa thams cad ni //
translated: All the states of beings

original: de ltar dmigs pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa ma yin no // zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: are not perceived in that way.

original: gal te dngos po don dam par med na bcom ldan 'das de ston pa mdzad pas de kho na gzigs pa ji ltar yin zhes de snyam du bsam par mi bya te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po don dam par med na bcom ldan 'das de ston pa mdzad pas de kho na gzigs pa ji ltar yin zhes de snyam du bsam par mi bya te /
translated: If things do not exist ultimately, how can the Blessed One be said to see reality, since he teaches that?

original: 'di ltar thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa'i bstan pa la 'jug pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i ngos yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa'i bstan pa la 'jug pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i ngos yin la /
translated: Do not think in that way, because the entry to the teaching of the compassionate one is the perspective of the disciples.

original: de la kha cig drang ba'i don yin kha cig nges pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de la kha cig drang ba'i don yin kha cig nges pa'i don yin no //
translated: Some of the scriptures are of provisional meaning and some are of definitive meaning.

original: drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'i rnam par dbye ba yang mdo gzhan du bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'i rnam par dbye ba yang mdo gzhan du bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: The division of the scriptures into those of provisional meaning and those of definitive meaning was taught by the Blessed One in another sūtra.

original: des na skyob pa des bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba kho nas ni de kho nar gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: des na skyob pa des bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba kho nas ni de kho nar gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should not be grasped as just that, “It is taught by that protector.”

original: slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: The master Dharmakīrti says:

original: des de nyid don btang snyoms can //
analyzed: des de nyid don btang snyoms can //
translated: He is indifferent to reality

original: glang chen gzigs stangs mdzad nas ni //
analyzed: glang chen gzigs stangs mdzad nas ni //
translated: and, with the gaze of an elephant,

original: 'jig rten thugs ni 'ba' zhig gis //
analyzed: 'jig rten thugs ni 'ba' zhig gis //
translated: with only the thought of the world,

original: phyi rol spyod pa spros pa yin //🔽zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol spyod pa spros pa yin // zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: he elaborates external activities.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas ;
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas ;
translated: The master Nāgārjuna says:

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to reverse the conception of a self,

original: phung po khams la sogs pa bstan //
analyzed: phung po khams la sogs pa bstan //
translated: the aggregates, constituents, and so on are taught.

original: sems tsam du ni rnam gzhag pas //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni rnam gzhag pas //
translated: By positing everything as mind only,

original: skal chen rnams kyis de yang bsal //
analyzed: skal chen rnams kyis de yang bsal //
translated: the fortunate will eliminate that as well.🔽The Great Sage taught

original: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam zhes //🔽thub pa chen pos gang bstan de //🔽byis pa rnams kyi skrag pa ni //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam zhes // thub pa chen pos gang bstan de // byis pa rnams kyi skrag pa ni //
translated: that all of this is mind only🔽in order to remove the fear of the childish;

original: bsal phyir @63b yin gyi de nyid min //
analyzed: bsal phyir @63b yin gyi de nyid min //
translated: it is not reality.

original: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: The master Vasubandhu also says:

original: gzugs sogs skye mched yod par ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs skye mched yod par ni //
translated: The existence of the sense bases such as form, etc.

original: des 'dul ba yi skye bo la //
analyzed: des 'dul ba yi skye bo la //
translated: is taught by the Victor for the sake of those beings who are to be trained by that.

original: dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste //
translated: It is taught by the power of intention,

original: brdzus te 'byung ba'i sems can bzhin //🔽lta ba'i mche bas smras pa dang // las rnams 'jig pa la ltos nas //
analyzed: brdzus te 'byung ba'i sems can bzhin // lta ba'i mche bas smras pa dang // las rnams 'jig pa la ltos nas //
translated: like the existence of spontaneously born beings.🔽The Victor taught this doctrine

original: stag mo phrug gu khyer ba ltar //
analyzed: stag mo phrug gu khyer ba ltar //
translated: like a tigress carries her cubs in her jaws,🔽in order to avoid the fangs of the view

original: rgyal bas chos 'di ston par mdzad //
analyzed: rgyal bas chos 'di ston par mdzad //
translated: and the destruction of karma.

original: ce'o // 'o na bcom 'das mi bden pa gsung bas na khyed cag nyid bcom ldan 'das la skur ba 'debs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ce'o // 'o na bcom 'das mi bden pa gsung bas na khyed cag nyid bcom ldan 'das la skur ba 'debs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Well, since the Bhagavān taught what is untrue, you yourself are denigrating the Bhagavān.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, we are not,

original: dgongs pa'i khyad par gyis brdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod par bstan pa bzhin du bstan pa gzhan yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i khyad par gyis brdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod par bstan pa bzhin du bstan pa gzhan yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because other teachings are correct, like the teaching of the existence of spontaneously born beings, which is made with a specific intention.

original: 'o na stong pa nyid bstan pa nyid yid la bstan du med do //
analyzed: 'o na stong pa nyid bstan pa nyid yid la bstan du med do //
translated: Well, the teaching of emptiness itself cannot be taught to the mind.

original: de la yang dgongs pa can yin pa'i dogs pa dag pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
analyzed: de la yang dgongs pa can yin pa'i dogs pa dag pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
translated: And it is not possible to purify the doubt that it is also intentional.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'di ltar re zhig stong pa nyid du bstan pa 'dul bar bya ba'i bsam pa'i ngor yin par sems dang ldan pas dogs par mi 'os te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig stong pa nyid du bstan pa 'dul bar bya ba'i bsam pa'i ngor yin par sems dang ldan pas dogs par mi 'os te /
translated: Thus, the teaching of emptiness is for the sake of those who are to be disciplined, and it is not proper to suspect that it is for the sake of the wise.

original: seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snyin po la sogs pa yang stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snyin po la sogs pa yang stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Siṃha, Hari, and Vasu were also fortunate enough to understand emptiness.

original: de ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das ston pa po'i tshogs kyi spyi gtsug gi nor bu yin te /🔽gal te 'dir ni sangs rgyas pa dang phyi rol la //
analyzed: de ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das ston pa po'i tshogs kyi spyi gtsug gi nor bu yin te / gal te 'dir ni sangs rgyas pa dang phyi rol la //
translated: The Lord is the crest-jewel of the assembly of teachers because he teaches that.🔽If there were no single teaching of emptiness

original: rnam par 'byed byed stong nyid bstan pa gcig med ni //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed byed stong nyid bstan pa gcig med ni //
translated: To distinguish Buddhists from non-Buddhists,

original: spyod pa zhi ba mos blo sbyangs rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: spyod pa zhi ba mos blo sbyangs rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' //
translated: Then the philosophy of those whose minds are trained in the aspiration for peace

original: thams cad rab tu rnam par phye na mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: thams cad rab tu rnam par phye na mtshungs pa yin //
translated: Would be completely indistinguishable.

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: mkhas pa su yang 'di rgyu mtshan gyis yin par yang rtogs par mi byed de /
analyzed: mkhas pa su yang 'di rgyu mtshan gyis yin par yang rtogs par mi byed de /
translated: No scholar would understand this to be the reason,

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other reason.

original: 'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'di snyam du /
translated: One might think as follows:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes gsungs pa na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes gsungs pa na /
translated: “O sons of the victors, this three-fold world is nothing but cognition.”

original: gdul bar bya ba rnams de nyid la 'dzin par ma gyur cig snyam ste /
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba rnams de nyid la 'dzin par ma gyur cig snyam ste /
translated: When this is taught, one should not grasp at it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de yang stong pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de yang stong pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The Bhagavat has taught that this is also empty.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we say:

original: gal te rnam par shes pa don dam pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa don dam pa kho na yin na /
translated: If consciousness is ultimate reality,🔽then there is no fault in clinging to it. Why then is it refuted?

original: de'i tshe mngon par zhen pa la nyes pa ci yang med pas na ci'i phyir phyir 'gog par byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon par zhen pa la nyes pa ci yang med pas na ci'i phyir phyir 'gog par byed /
translated: If one thinks,

original: ji ste / 'di dag rnam rig tsam nyid ces //🔽de snyam du ni dmigs nas su //
analyzed: ji ste / 'di dag rnam rig tsam nyid ces // de snyam du ni dmigs nas su //
translated: “These are nothing but cognition-only,”🔽and then

original: ci yang rung ste @64a * //
analyzed: ci yang rung ste @64a * //
translated: whatever appears

original: mdun 'jog na //
analyzed: mdun 'jog na //
translated: is placed in front of one,

original: de tsam la ni gnas ma yin //
analyzed: de tsam la ni gnas ma yin //
translated: one does not abide in that alone.

original: snyam du sems na /
analyzed: snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks this,

original: de lta na 'o na de tsam du bstan pa kho nas der mngon par zhen pa bsal bas na stong pa nyid bstan pas mi dgos so //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na de tsam du bstan pa kho nas der mngon par zhen pa bsal bas na stong pa nyid bstan pas mi dgos so //
translated: then the mere teaching of that would remove clinging to it, and so there would be no need for the teaching of emptiness.

original: gal te 'di mngon par zhen pa bkag pa tsam dgos pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di mngon par zhen pa bkag pa tsam dgos pa yin na /
translated: If the purpose of this is merely to refute attachment,🔽then one should not become attached to this either.

original: 'di la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhe na tshul drang po kho nar gsungs par rigs na rnam pa gzhan du gsungs pas ci bya /
analyzed: 'di la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhe na tshul drang po kho nar gsungs par rigs na rnam pa gzhan du gsungs pas ci bya /
translated: If it is proper to teach in a straightforward manner, what is the point of teaching in a different way?

original: rnam pa gzhan du gsungs na ni ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du 'dzin pa mi bden pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du gsungs na ni ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du 'dzin pa mi bden pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is taught in a different way, then it would be necessary to grasp it in a way that is not literal.

original: de lta na yang don ma yin pa chung ngu las bzlog pa'i gdul bya don ma yin pas chen po nyams par bsgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang don ma yin pa chung ngu las bzlog pa'i gdul bya don ma yin pas chen po nyams par bsgyur ba yin no //
translated: If that were so, then disciples who are turned away from a small nonvirtuous action would be turned away from a great nonvirtuous action.

original: des na shes pa dang shes bya yin par bstan pa ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na shes pa dang shes bya yin par bstan pa ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the teaching that consciousness and objects of consciousness exist is a teaching of a sūtra of provisional meaning.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ni ma yin no zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ni ma yin no zhes rtogs so //
translated: One should understand that it is not the case that they exist in reality.

original: 'di las kyang drang ba'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang drang ba'i don ma yin te /
translated: This is also not a sūtra of provisional meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa bstan pa ni thams cad du nges pa'i don nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa bstan pa ni thams cad du nges pa'i don nyid du snang ste /
translated: The teaching of negation by the Bhagavat appears to be of definitive meaning in all cases.

original: dper na / 'di ni bdag gam sems can med //🔽chos 'di rgyu dang bcas las byung //
analyzed: dper na / 'di ni bdag gam sems can med // chos 'di rgyu dang bcas las byung //
translated: This has no self or sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: This phenomenon arises from causes and actions.

original: de bzhin du myu gu 'di ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas gnyi gas ma byas dbang phyug gis sbrul pa ma yin du yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du myu gu 'di ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas gnyi gas ma byas dbang phyug gis sbrul pa ma yin du yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: Similarly, this sprout is not self-produced, not produced by another, not produced by both, not produced by a creator, not produced by transformation,🔽not produced from a combination of the four elements, not produced from a single cause, and not produced without a cause.

original: rang bzhin las las byung ba ma yin rgyu gcig la rag las pa ma yin rgyu med par byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: rang bzhin las las byung ba ma yin rgyu gcig la rag las pa ma yin rgyu med par byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly, it is like the statement:

original: ming ni gang dang gang zhig gis /
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang zhig gis /
translated: Whatever name is used

original: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: for whatever phenomenon is expressed,

original: de ni de la yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni de la yod ma yin //
translated: that does not exist in that.

original: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
translated: That is the reality of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /🔽ji ltar byings pas rnam brtags ltar //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du / ji ltar byings pas rnam brtags ltar //
translated: And similarly, it is like the statement:

original: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
translated: External objects do not exist🔽as they are imagined by the childish.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind disturbed by latent propensities

original: don du snang bar rab tu 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: don du snang bar rab tu 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: appears as external objects.

original: sgrub pa bstan pa ni rnam pa snang bas na de nyid la drang ba'i don du srid pa rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa bstan pa ni rnam pa snang bas na de nyid la drang ba'i don du srid pa rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the proof is that since the aspect appears, it is the interpretable meaning, and it is possible to be consistent with the reasonings of existence.

original: ji ste de lta yin yang drang ba'i don du rtogs na /
analyzed: ji ste de lta yin yang drang ba'i don du rtogs na /
translated: If one understands it as interpretable meaning in that way,🔽one should consider the teaching of the selflessness of personality in the same way.

original: gang zag gi bdag med par bstan pa yang de ltar brtag par gyis shig / gzhan yang 'o na gal te dbu ma pa rnams kyi bsgrub bya grub pa grub byed la rag lus na /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med par bstan pa yang de ltar brtag par gyis shig / gzhan yang 'o na gal te dbu ma pa rnams kyi bsgrub bya grub pa grub byed la rag lus na /
translated: Moreover, if the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the probandum by the Madhyamikas depends on the probandum,

original: 'o na bsgrub bya grub par byed pas don byed nus pa ji ltar stong pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na bsgrub bya grub par byed pas don byed nus pa ji ltar stong pa yin te /
translated: then how can the accomplishment of the probandum by the accomplishment of the probandum be empty of the ability to perform a function?🔽For it is said,

original: don byed nus pa gang yin pa //🔽de 'dir don dam yod pa yin //🔽zhes gang gsungs pa'o dam yod pa yin //
analyzed: don byed nus pa gang yin pa // de 'dir don dam yod pa yin // zhes gang gsungs pa'o dam yod pa yin //
translated: Whatever is able to perform a function🔽Is here said to be ultimately existent.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'o /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'o /
translated: If the performance of a function is ultimate, it would be so here.

original: @64b zhe na ;🔽brjod pa / gal te don byed pa don dam pa pa yin na 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: @64b zhe na ;🔽brjod pa / gal te don byed pa don dam pa pa yin na 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But it is not so.

original: byed po dang las dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pas na 'di don dam pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: byed po dang las dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pas na 'di don dam pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin /
translated: Since the agent and action are empty of the nature of being one or many, how could this be called “ultimate”?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni ci yang med la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni ci yang med la /
translated: There is no valid cognition that establishes the nature of cause and effect,

original: gnod par byed pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par yod pas na don byed nus pa don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par yod pas na don byed nus pa don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: and there is no fault in the absence of such a valid cognition. Therefore it is not tenable that the definition of ultimate existence is “that which is able to perform a function.”

original: 'di ni brjod par bya ba mang bas re zhig gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ni brjod par bya ba mang bas re zhig gzhag ste /
translated: Since there is much to be said here, I will leave it for the time being.

original: 'dir rnam 'grel mdzad pas ni tha snyad la brten pa'i don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa yin pas de'i dgongs pa dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'dir rnam 'grel mdzad pas ni tha snyad la brten pa'i don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa yin pas de'i dgongs pa dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Here the author of the Pramii(laviirttikam) speaks of the definition of ultimate existence in terms of conventional existence. Therefore there is no contradiction with his intention.

original: rigs pa'i dbang phyug mchog de ni don dam par na dbu ma pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rigs pa'i dbang phyug mchog de ni don dam par na dbu ma pa kho na ste /
translated: The supreme lord of reasoning is a Madhyamika in the ultimate sense.

original: gal te thams cad nus med na //🔽sa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
analyzed: gal te thams cad nus med na // sa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
translated: If all things are without power,

original: nus mthong gal te de kun rdzob //
analyzed: nus mthong gal te de kun rdzob //
translated: then seeds and such are seen to have power over sprouts and so forth.🔽If you say that this is a convention,

original: 'dod na ji ltar de lta yin //
analyzed: 'dod na ji ltar de lta yin //
translated: then why is it not so in the case of the ultimate?

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, he is a Madhyamika.

original: 'di las kyang dbu ma pa yin te /🔽sna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
analyzed: 'di las kyang dbu ma pa yin te / sna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
translated: He is also a Madhyamika because of this:🔽If it is not correct that various objects

original: gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na //🔽re zhig gcig bu'i blo de nyid //
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na // re zhig gcig bu'i blo de nyid //
translated: Are one,🔽Then how does that very mind which is alone

original: sna tshogs su ni ji ltar snang //
analyzed: sna tshogs su ni ji ltar snang //
translated: Appear as various?

original: zhes phyogs snga ma bslang ba sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: zhes phyogs snga ma bslang ba sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: Thus, having first raised the opponent's position,🔽The wise have said,

original: ji lta ji ltar don bsams la //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar don bsams la //
translated: The more you think about objects,

original: de lta de ltar rnam dben zhes //🔽mkhas pa rnams ni gang gsung ba //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam dben zhes // mkhas pa rnams ni gang gsung ba //
translated: The more you will be separated from them.

original: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin ;
analyzed: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin ;
translated: This is the power of fact.

original: / sna tshogs gcig na ci zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: / sna tshogs gcig na ci zhig 'gyur //
translated: If the various are one, what will happen?

original: blo de la ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo de la ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That mind will not be various.

original: gal te don 'gal 'di 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te don 'gal 'di 'dod na //
translated: If you accept this contradiction,

original: de la kho bo ci zhig yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la kho bo ci zhig yin // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: What will you say to us?

original: rnam par shes pa'i skabs nyid nas //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i skabs nyid nas //
translated: In the chapter on consciousness,

original: gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad nas //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad nas //
translated: Having analyzed things,

original: de nyid du na de dngos med //
analyzed: de nyid du na de dngos med //
translated: They are not things in reality.

original: gang gi phyir na de dag la//
analyzed: gang gi phyir na de dag la//
translated: Because they do not have

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
translated: The nature of being one or many.

original: ces bya ba 'di las kyang yin te //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di las kyang yin te //
translated: This is also the case.

original: phyi rol dang nang thun mong du sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang thun mong du sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: This is a refutation in common with the outsiders and insiders.

original: dbu ma pa'i lugs kyi bdud rtsi la dgyes pa mi mnga' na ni //
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i lugs kyi bdud rtsi la dgyes pa mi mnga' na ni //
translated: If you do not delight in the nectar of the Madhyamaka system,

original: de skad gsungs pa rigs par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa rigs par ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see that what you say is reasonable.

original: gang la / rigs lam srang zhugs 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: gang la / rigs lam srang zhugs 'gro ba ni //
translated: For those who have entered the path of reasoning,

original: gcig tu byas dang bdag gi blo //🔽'on kyang yongs su rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: gcig tu byas dang bdag gi blo // 'on kyang yongs su rtogs pa ni //
translated: my mind is one with theirs.🔽Nevertheless, if there are those who are fortunate,

original: skal ldan yod na de rnams rgyal //
analyzed: skal ldan yod na de rnams rgyal //
translated: may they be victorious.

original: zhes bya ba'i seng ge'i sgra yod cing //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i seng ge'i sgra yod cing //
translated: There is the lion's roar:🔽He who possesses supreme wisdom,

original: gang zhig shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pas lha'i bla ma rgyang ring du smad cing bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pas lha'i bla ma rgyang ring du smad cing bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang mtshungs so //
translated: is praised by the teacher of the gods, and is equal to the noble Mañjuśrī of the Bhagavān.

original: gang la @65a * //
analyzed: gang la @65a * //
translated: For whom?

original: bsngags pa 'thob pa rnams lta ba ngan pa'i g-yang sa chen por lhung ba'i sems can la thugs brtse bas rje btsun kun tu bzang po gshegs par bsngags pa brjod pa /
analyzed: bsngags pa 'thob pa rnams lta ba ngan pa'i g-yang sa chen por lhung ba'i sems can la thugs brtse bas rje btsun kun tu bzang po gshegs par bsngags pa brjod pa /
translated: Those who attain praise, with compassion for beings who have fallen into the abyss of wrong views, praise the departure of the venerable Samantabhadra.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i gsang sngags kyis mu stegs ngan pa'i sha za skrag par mdzad pa tshad ma pa'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bu ste /🔽dbu ma pa'i grub mtha' la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la blo dang ldan pa su zhig yid ches par 'gyur /🔽de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis lung las khong du chud cing tshad mas yongs su dag la /🔽'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas gsal bar mdzad pa /🔽slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas bzhed pa'i dbu ma de kho na 'di blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas blang ba dang / goms par bya bar 'os pa yin te /🔽re zhig mos pa tsam yang bsod nams dag pa sogs pa'i rgyu yin na /🔽goms pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i gsang sngags kyis mu stegs ngan pa'i sha za skrag par mdzad pa tshad ma pa'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bu ste / dbu ma pa'i grub mtha' la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la blo dang ldan pa su zhig yid ches par 'gyur / de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis lung las khong du chud cing tshad mas yongs su dag la / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas gsal bar mdzad pa / slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas bzhed pa'i dbu ma de kho na 'di blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas blang ba dang / goms par bya bar 'os pa yin te / re zhig mos pa tsam yang bsod nams dag pa sogs pa'i rgyu yin na / goms pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: The crest-jewel of the assembly of logicians, who, with the pure mantra that is free of sin, terrified the flesh-eating evil extremists,

original: ji skad du /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis /

the crest-jewel of the assembly of logicians, who, with the pure mantra that is free of sin, terrified the flesh-eating evil extremists

original: byang chub sems kyi bsod nams gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi bsod nams gang //
translated: Whatever merit there is in the thought of awakening,

original: de la gal te gzugs mchis na //
analyzed: de la gal te gzugs mchis na //
translated: if it were to have a form,

original: nam mkha'i khams ni kun gang ste //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni kun gang ste //
translated: it would fill the whole realm of space

original: de ni de las lhag par 'gyur //🔽sems can kun gyi bsod nams kyi //
analyzed: de ni de las lhag par 'gyur // sems can kun gyi bsod nams kyi //
translated: and extend beyond that.🔽Whatever is the total mass of merit

original: phung po yongs su ji snyed pa //🔽de snyed byang chub sems dpa'i yi//
analyzed: phung po yongs su ji snyed pa // de snyed byang chub sems dpa'i yi//
translated: of all sentient beings,🔽that much is the merit

original: byang chub sems las rab tu 'byung //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi //
analyzed: byang chub sems las rab tu 'byung // byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi //
translated: of the thought of awakening of the bodhisattva.🔽Whatever is the mass of merit

original: phung po 'byung ba ji snyed pa //
analyzed: phung po 'byung ba ji snyed pa //
translated: of the bodhisattva,

original: dam tshig yongs su 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: dam tshig yongs su 'dzin pa yi //
translated: the merit of upholding the commitments

original: bsod nams de bas shin tu yang //
analyzed: bsod nams de bas shin tu yang //
translated: is even greater than that.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'bad pa yis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'bad pa yis //
translated: Even if all the buddhas

original: bskal pa bye bar bka' stsal yang //🔽dam chos 'dzin pa'i bsod nams kyis //
analyzed: bskal pa bye bar bka' stsal yang // dam chos 'dzin pa'i bsod nams kyis //
translated: were to speak for ten million eons,

original: mthar ni phyin par mi 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems dang dam pa'i chos //🔽yang dag sdud las bsod nams gang //
analyzed: mthar ni phyin par mi 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dang dam pa'i chos // yang dag sdud las bsod nams gang //
translated: they would not reach the end🔽of the merit of upholding the true Dharma.

original: stong pa nyid la la mos pa yi //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la la mos pa yi //
translated: Whatever merit there is in the thought of awakening🔽and in upholding the true Dharma,

original: / bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: / bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
translated: it does not equal even a sixteenth🔽of the merit of aspiring to emptiness.

original: 'dir ni stong nyid la mos shing //
analyzed: 'dir ni stong nyid la mos shing //
translated: Here, one is devoted to emptiness,

original: byang chub sems ni 'dor mi byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni 'dor mi byed //
translated: and does not abandon the thought of awakening.

original: dam pa'i chos nyid 'dzin byed pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyid 'dzin byed pa //
translated: One upholds the very Dharma itself.

original: 'di ni bsod nams mdor bsdus yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams mdor bsdus yin // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of merit.

original: de kho na 'di las goms par byed pa rnams la ni tshegs med par mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de kho na 'di las goms par byed pa rnams la ni tshegs med par mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob pa 'byung ste /
translated: For those who cultivate suchness, the attainment of high status and certain goodness occurs without difficulty.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsod nams kyi sgrub pa nyam su @65b blang ba la ji ltar gyur pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba de lta bu dmigs pa'i tshul las ma yin te /🔽tshad mas gnod byed nyid kyi sgrib pa spong ba tsam yod kyi //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsod nams kyi sgrub pa nyam su @65b blang ba la ji ltar gyur pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba de lta bu dmigs pa'i tshul las ma yin te / tshad mas gnod byed nyid kyi sgrib pa spong ba tsam yod kyi //
translated: The result that occurs from taking up the practice of merit in a way that does not objectify is not like that from objectifying.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong pa dngos po la //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong pa dngos po la //
translated: There is only the elimination of the obscurations that are contradicted by valid knowledge.🔽The elimination of the obscurations to omniscience

original: phyin ci log tu yongs su nge //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu yongs su nge //
translated: is completely mistaken with regard to things.

original: de phyir de stobs zhugs pa yi //
analyzed: de phyir de stobs zhugs pa yi //
translated: Therefore, the power of that

original: phyi rol phyin pa sgrub pa kun ;
analyzed: phyi rol phyin pa sgrub pa kun ;
translated: is the accomplishment of all the perfections.

original: / bdag dang bdag gir phyin log las //
analyzed: / bdag dang bdag gir phyin log las //
translated: The self and mine are mistaken.

original: zhugs pa bzhin du stobs chung ngo //🔽dngos por mi dmigs pa yis ni //🔽zhugs pa 'bras bu chen po ste //
analyzed: zhugs pa bzhin du stobs chung ngo // dngos por mi dmigs pa yis ni // zhugs pa 'bras bu chen po ste //
translated: The path of preparation is weak, like a seed.

original: rgyas pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: The path of preparation is great, because it is the cause of the path of seeing.

original: sa bon grung po'i myug sogs bzhin //
analyzed: sa bon grung po'i myug sogs bzhin //
translated: It is like the sprout of a strong seed.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: nges par legs pa phul du byung ba 'thob pa ni phyin ci log gi dbang du byas pa'i yid can rnams la mi srid pa kho na ste /
analyzed: nges par legs pa phul du byung ba 'thob pa ni phyin ci log gi dbang du byas pa'i yid can rnams la mi srid pa kho na ste /
translated: The attainment of the highest, complete enlightenment is impossible for those whose minds are under the influence of error.

original: gang zag gi bdag med par lta ba rnams la 'ga' zhig gis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba tsam yod kyi //
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med par lta ba rnams la 'ga' zhig gis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba tsam yod kyi //
translated: For those who see the selflessness of the person, there is the mere elimination of the afflictive obstructions,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but there is no elimination of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: chos kyi bdag med pa cung zad mthong ba rnams kyang de las gzhan pa'i yul la phyin ci log dang bral ba ma tshang bas de mtha' dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa cung zad mthong ba rnams kyang de las gzhan pa'i yul la phyin ci log dang bral ba ma tshang bas de mtha' dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who see a little of the selflessness of phenomena are not completely free from error with regard to other objects, and therefore they do not have complete enlightenment.

original: des na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs par 'dod pa rnams la de las ma gtogs pa goms par bya ba ci yang med pas na /
analyzed: des na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs par 'dod pa rnams la de las ma gtogs pa goms par bya ba ci yang med pas na /
translated: Therefore, those who desire high status and definite goodness have nothing to cultivate other than this.

original: de kho na 'di kho na la goms par bya bar 'os pa yin no //🔽gang dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de kho na 'di kho na la goms par bya bar 'os pa yin no // gang dag 'di skad du /
translated: Thus, it is appropriate to cultivate this reality alone.

original: gal te bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa de'i 'bras bu'i yang brdzun pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa de'i 'bras bu'i yang brdzun pa kho na yin na /
translated: Some say: If the results of virtue and nonvirtue are false,

original: de ci'i phyir dbu ma pa rnams bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa bsgrub pa len pa dang 'dor ba dag gis /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir dbu ma pa rnams bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa bsgrub pa len pa dang 'dor ba dag gis /
translated: why do Madhyamikas, through accepting and rejecting the cultivation of virtue and the noncultivation of nonvirtue,

original: bdag dub par byed de /
analyzed: bdag dub par byed de /
translated: exhaust themselves?

original: de dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa kho nar spyod pa mdzes so zhes zer ba ni mi rigs pa smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa kho nar spyod pa mdzes so zhes zer ba ni mi rigs pa smra ba yin te /
translated: It is better for them to do whatever they want.

original: 'di ltar dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags ma spangs pa rigs kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags ma spangs pa rigs kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas /
translated: This is illogical because those who say this have not abandoned the latent propensities of attachment to things and through the power of their lineage, they engage in inference.

original: nges pa'i stong pa'i de kho na la mos ba'i skyes bu'i dbang du byas nas 'di brjod dam ;
analyzed: nges pa'i stong pa'i de kho na la mos ba'i skyes bu'i dbang du byas nas 'di brjod dam ;
translated: This is stated from the perspective of a person who is devoted to the emptiness that is the suchness of definitive meaning.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags spangs pa la yin grang /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags spangs pa la yin grang /
translated: Or is it for one who has abandoned the latent propensities for overt adherence to things?

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas brjod na ni /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas brjod na ni /
translated: If it is stated from the first perspective,

original: yang dag par brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not a correct statement.

original: gang dag dngos la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags ma spangs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag dngos la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags ma spangs pa de dag ni /
translated: For those who have not abandoned the latent propensities for overt adherence to things,

original: rigs pa dang lung gis de kho na des kyang de las @66a * //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung gis de kho na des kyang de las @66a * //
translated: reasoning and scripture will not cause them to relinquish their adherence to things.

original: gzhan pa'i skye bo dang thun mong du tha snyad 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i skye bo dang thun mong du tha snyad 'jug pa yin te /
translated: They will engage in conventional usage in common with other people who are not like them.

original: de dang de las gzhan pa dag la tha snyad la ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de dang de las gzhan pa dag la tha snyad la ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all in their conventional usage from that of others.

original: des na 'di dag bsod nams sgrub pa la 'jug pa dang / sdig pa'i sgrub pa dang ldog pa la spyod par mi 'os so //
analyzed: des na 'di dag bsod nams sgrub pa la 'jug pa dang / sdig pa'i sgrub pa dang ldog pa la spyod par mi 'os so //
translated: Therefore, it is not appropriate for them to engage in the cultivation of merit and to turn away from the cultivation of misdeeds.

original: rnam par phyed pa rnams rnam par ma phyed pa'i 'jig rten dang tha snyad thun mong du mi rigs pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par phyed pa rnams rnam par ma phyed pa'i 'jig rten dang tha snyad thun mong du mi rigs pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: It is not at all reasonable for those who have analyzed to share the same conventions as the world of non-analyzers.

original: 'o na de dag gis gang la yang 'jug par mi bya zhing gang las kyang ldog par mi bya bas na /
analyzed: 'o na de dag gis gang la yang 'jug par mi bya zhing gang las kyang ldog par mi bya bas na /
translated: Well then, since they would not engage in anything and would not refrain from anything,

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / sdug pa la 'khyud pa la sogs pa la yang mi 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / sdug pa la 'khyud pa la sogs pa la yang mi 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: they would not engage in eating, drinking, embracing a lover, and so on.

original: sbrul dang dug dang tsher ma la sogs pa las kyang mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrul dang dug dang tsher ma la sogs pa las kyang mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not refrain from snakes, poison, thorns, and so on.

original: yang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig brdzun par ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig brdzun par ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, not only are some of the results of virtue and nonvirtue false,

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad yin no //
translated: but all phenomena are.

original: de la gal te 'ga' zhig brdzun na ni //
analyzed: de la gal te 'ga' zhig brdzun na ni //
translated: If some are false,

original: brdzun pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub pa len pa dang ; spong ba'i yul can gyi bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba yang de lta bu kho na yin la /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub pa len pa dang ; spong ba'i yul can gyi bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba yang de lta bu kho na yin la /
translated: The establishment of merit and demerit that are the subjects of the practice of false happiness and suffering, and the practice of abandoning and accepting, are just like that.

original: ma yin na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: ma yin na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: If they are not, then it is certain that they are not at all.

original: de'i phyir ji srid du len pa dang / spong ba'i tha snyad 'di 'jug pa de srid du legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i yul rjes su zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid du len pa dang / spong ba'i tha snyad 'di 'jug pa de srid du legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i yul rjes su zhugs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as the conventions of accepting and abandoning are in operation, one should engage in the objects of good and bad conduct.

original: dbu ma par rlom pa gang dag bsod nams la ni mi gus shing bsod nams ma yin pa mi spong ba de dag ni bde 'gro dang / thar pa'i snod du ma gyur pa ngan 'gro'i nyon mongs pa de dag ni bcom pa yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma par rlom pa gang dag bsod nams la ni mi gus shing bsod nams ma yin pa mi spong ba de dag ni bde 'gro dang / thar pa'i snod du ma gyur pa ngan 'gro'i nyon mongs pa de dag ni bcom pa yin te /
translated: Those who pretend to be Madhyamikas, who have no respect for merit and do not abandon demerit, are not vessels for happy rebirth and liberation. They are destroyed by the afflictions of bad rebirth.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam par dben don mi shes shing ;
analyzed: rnam par dben don mi shes shing ;
translated: Not knowing the meaning of emptiness,

original: / thos pa tsam la rten byed pa //
analyzed: / thos pa tsam la rten byed pa //
translated: They rely on mere hearing.

original: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
analyzed: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
translated: Those who do not create merit

original: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag //🔽ces gsungs so //🔽ji ste gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod na /
analyzed: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag // ces gsungs so // ji ste gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod na /
translated: Those wicked people are lost.

original: de lta na yang yang dag par brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang yang dag par brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: If, on the other hand, you take the second alternative, then also it is not correct,

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags spangs pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags spangs pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: because those who have abandoned the habit-energy of attachment to things

original: 'jug par byed pa'i bdag dang / 'jug pa dang 'jug pa'i yul yang mi dmigs pas 'ga' la yang 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i bdag dang / 'jug pa dang 'jug pa'i yul yang mi dmigs pas 'ga' la yang 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: do not engage in anything, because they do not perceive an engaging self, nor engagement, nor an object of engagement.

original: gang yang dbu ma pa rnams ni ji ltar 'dod par spyod pa nyid mdzes so zhes brjod pa de ni shin tu 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dbu ma pa rnams ni ji ltar 'dod par spyod pa nyid mdzes so zhes brjod pa de ni shin tu 'brel pa yin te /
translated: And it is very relevant to say that it is proper for the Madhyamikas to act as they please,

original: thams cad brdzun pa yin na @66b ni spyod pa med pa nyid rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad brdzun pa yin na @66b ni spyod pa med pa nyid rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: because if everything is false, then it is proper to act without action,

original: ji ltar 'dod par spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not as one pleases.

original: ha cang thal bas chog go //🔽'di na mu stegs can gzhung mun pa ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: ha cang thal bas chog go // 'di na mu stegs can gzhung mun pa ma lus pa'i //
translated: Enough of this excess of verbosity!

original: nyi ma thub chen rgyal po la brten rnam 'byed pa //
analyzed: nyi ma thub chen rgyal po la brten rnam 'byed pa //
translated: Here, the sun of the great sage, the king, dispels the entire darkness of the treatises of the tirthikas.

original: byis pa'i skye bo'i ched du sla ba'i rim pa yis //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo'i ched du sla ba'i rim pa yis //
translated: For the sake of childish beings, with an easy approach,

original: bstan pa de ni snying rjes bdag gis rnam par phye //
analyzed: bstan pa de ni snying rjes bdag gis rnam par phye //
translated: I have opened up this teaching out of compassion.

original: de ltas nam mkha' la ni 'gran par byed 'dra zhing //
analyzed: de ltas nam mkha' la ni 'gran par byed 'dra zhing //
translated: Thus, as if rivaling the sky,

original: zla ba'i 'od kyi tshogs la bsngo ba lta bu yi //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od kyi tshogs la bsngo ba lta bu yi //
translated: And as if dedicating to the host of moonbeams,

original: yangs shing dri ma med pa'i dge ba gang thob des //
analyzed: yangs shing dri ma med pa'i dge ba gang thob des //
translated: Whatever vast and stainless virtue I have obtained,

original: 'jig rten byang chub bdud rtsi'i rgya mtshor nub gyur cig //🔽ma lus mu stegs ngan pa'i cho gas mi tshugs pa'i //
analyzed: 'jig rten byang chub bdud rtsi'i rgya mtshor nub gyur cig // ma lus mu stegs ngan pa'i cho gas mi tshugs pa'i //
translated: By that, may the world sink into the ocean of the nectar of enlightenment.

original: bde gshegs bstan pa rin chen sgron me ma lus pa //
analyzed: bde gshegs bstan pa rin chen sgron me ma lus pa //
translated: May the entire precious lamp of the Sugata's teachings,🔽Not be destroyed by the evil rites of the non-Buddhist extremists,

original: lta bar gyur pa'i mun pa drungs 'byin ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa'i mun pa drungs 'byin ma lus pa'i //
translated: May the darkness of wrong views be completely eradicated,🔽And the nature of reality, clear and radiant, be revealed.

original: dngos po'i gnas lugs rang bzhin gsal zhing 'bar gyur cig / bdag ni thams cad rab gtong bzhin 'dzum 'jam par smra //🔽snyad med mdzes shing rga dang na las 'grol ba'i lus //
analyzed: dngos po'i gnas lugs rang bzhin gsal zhing 'bar gyur cig / bdag ni thams cad rab gtong bzhin 'dzum 'jam par smra // snyad med mdzes shing rga dang na las 'grol ba'i lus //
translated: I am one who gives everything, speaks gently with a smile,🔽Blameless, beautiful, and liberates from old age and sickness.

original: skye dran rlom sems med yid bzod ldan smra mkhas shing //
analyzed: skye dran rlom sems med yid bzod ldan smra mkhas shing //
translated: Mindful of past lives, free of conceit, patient, eloquent,

original: snyan dngags mkhas dang ngag dngos rgya mtsho'i pha mthar phyin //
analyzed: snyan dngags mkhas dang ngag dngos rgya mtsho'i pha mthar phyin //
translated: Skilled in poetry and eloquence, they reach the far shore of the ocean of speech.

original: lhag pa'i yon tan thos pa 'dzin zhing brtan la sgyu rtsal rnams la mkhas //
analyzed: lhag pa'i yon tan thos pa 'dzin zhing brtan la sgyu rtsal rnams la mkhas //
translated: They retain the higher qualities they hear and are steadfast, skilled in the arts.

original: zhi ba'i bdag can yul gyi longs spyod rgyab phyogs tshul khrims rgya chen la gnas pa //
analyzed: zhi ba'i bdag can yul gyi longs spyod rgyab phyogs tshul khrims rgya chen la gnas pa //
translated: With peaceful natures, they turn their backs on worldly enjoyments and abide by vast ethical discipline.

original: gcig tu sems can don la dga' zhing byang chub 'dod med 'khor ba'i mthar thug par //
analyzed: gcig tu sems can don la dga' zhing byang chub 'dod med 'khor ba'i mthar thug par //
translated: They delight solely in benefiting sentient beings and, without desiring enlightenment, reach the end of cyclic existence.

original: skye ba spangs shing rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa goms byed shog //
analyzed: skye ba spangs shing rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa goms byed shog //
translated: Abandoning birth, may they continuously engage in the conduct of bodhisattvas.🔽What person could explain the distinctions of the basis of the six higher perceptions?

original: mngon shes drug rten rnam dbye bshad la bdag su zhig / gang brjod de yang 'di ni g-yo bag sgyu can yin //
analyzed: mngon shes drug rten rnam dbye bshad la bdag su zhig / gang brjod de yang 'di ni g-yo bag sgyu can yin //
translated: That is also deceitful and deceptive, like a skilled magician.

original: sgyu rtsal la mkhas rigs bcas rig 'dzin bzhin pad ma //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal la mkhas rigs bcas rig 'dzin bzhin pad ma //
translated: Like a vidyādhara with a lotus face, skilled in the arts,

original: ka ma la ming ku sha le ni shin tu gcugs //
analyzed: ka ma la ming ku sha le ni shin tu gcugs //
translated: the one named Kamala is very dear to me.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung rnam par 'byed pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung rnam par 'byed pa'i bshad pa /
translated: Commentary on the Scripture of the Sugata

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gcig tu gzhol ba'i slob dpon dgra las rgyal bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gcig tu gzhol ba'i slob dpon dgra las rgyal bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the treatise composed by the master Victorious over the Enemy, who is wholly devoted to the practice of the bodhisattvas.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhas pa chen po ka na ka shr'i mi tra dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba ban de shes rab grags kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhas pa chen po ka na ka shr'i mi tra dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba ban de shes rab grags kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian scholar Kanakavara and the translator-monk, the Tibetan Sherab Drak.
